loans.use: Para emprender un cyber en su local, de esta forma complementa su servicio a los clientes que en su mayoría son estudiantes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in tables and chairs for his business.

loans.name: Itab

texts.en:
Itab is a 34-year-old Syrian citizen who has been running her grocery shop since 1998 to support her husband in covering their families needs and education expenses.
Itab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children increasing school tuition fees, since she and her husband's main aim is to provide their children with the best education. Itab might also invest part of the loan in increasing her business merchandise.
She hope that in the future she can expand her work and open another branch in a different location.

loans.use: To pay for her children increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don  Juan de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos,  el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 33 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicida, insecticidas y semillas etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo para temer mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Juan, who is 51 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He has been raising corn, beans, and sorghum for 33 years. He began using his own capital. He sells his products in the areas surrounding the zone where he lives.

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of compost, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc., to thus continue with his work in order to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, rice, snack food and others.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, rice, snack food and others.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 48-year-old married woman with three children, one attends school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena has run a general store for 10 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 50-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily has runa a general store for 17 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, and drinks.
She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, and drinks.

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes Group

texts.es: Don Marcelino, tiene 63 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de la Iguala Lempira. Toda su vida la a dedicado a la agricultura, con el cultivo de granos básicos y con mayor producción de café el cual vende despulpado y lavado en la misma zona a intermediarios. Ha obtenido varios préstamo con la institución en forma grupal, el que solicita actualmente es para comprar abonos para darle mejor asistencia al cultivo de café, y así poder mejorar la producción. Su plan es seguir creciendo con su cultivo y dejarles un buen patrimonio a su familia. El grupo se llama Nuevos Horizontes formado por 4 miembros que también se dedican a la producción de café en la misma zona, ellos llevan varios ciclos de trabajar juntos y están solicitando un préstamo total de 95,000 Lempiras para darle asistencia a sus cultivos. En la foto esta Ciriaco a la izquierda, Martin, Juan y Marcelino a la derecha.
texts.en: Don Marcelino is 63 years old. He is married with 5 children, and lives in an village in the municipality of la Iguala Lempira. He dedicated all of his life to agriculture, growing basic grains and a larger coffee production which he sells dehusked and cleaned in the same zone to intermediaries. He got several group loans with the institution, and the loan he is currently requesting is to buy manure to provide better care forhis coffee crops and thus improve production. His plan is to continue growing his crops and leave a good legacy for his family. The group is named Nuevos Horizontes, and it is formed by 4 members who also work growing coffee in the same zone. They have worked together for various cycles and are asking for a total loan of 95,000 Lempiras to provide assistance to their crops. The picture shows Ciriaco on the left, Martin, Juan and Marcelino on the right.

loans.use: To buy manure to provide better care his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chairs, tables, tablecloths, coffee makers, and more for her rental business.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 37-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Fifteen years ago, he started working in vehicle repairs, specializing in body work.
 
Wissam is an ambitious man and hard worker who is well known among his region. He suffered at the beginning from the limited customers inside the camp, but through the years he succeeded in gaining loyal customers from inside and outside the camp. 

He is trying hard to develop his business; thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy updated tools and a car scanner that will facilitate his business and allow him to provide his customers with better and quicker service. 

Wissam hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy updated tools and a car scanner

loans.name: Al Wefak1 50270 Group

texts.en:
Rana is the featured borrower for Al Wefak1 50270 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rana is a 45-year-old married mother of three children. Twelve years ago she started embroidering to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Rana is a hard worker and ambitious lady, who is well-known among her region. She has professional and creative skills in this domain. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools and materials for her business (bobbins, thread, ribbon, etc..). She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Rana is the lady sitting in the middle.
With respect to the other group members, Zeinat is the first lady on the right, and Mona is the first lady on the left.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and materials for her embroidery business - bobbins, thread, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23  y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, maíz, frijol y maicillo tiene 7 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicida, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y controles de plaga, para continuar con sus siembra ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 23 years old and lives in a zone of high risk, raises basic grains, corn, beans, and sorghum. He has seven years of experience, and he began using his own capital. He sells his products in the neighboring towns, and with what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of the expenses of his household. This young man lives in his own house with his wife and their two children.

He is applying for a loan for the purchase of herbicides, compost, seeds, fertilizers, and pest controls in order to continue with his planting, since this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, compost, seeds, fertilizers, and pest controls.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children.

She has a recycled materials and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more recycled materials.

She earns additional income through other business ventures like raising livestock.

Angelina wishes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials and sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with 5 children who works hard to support her family.

She sells recycled materials and earns additional income from food vending. Beverly is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more recycled materials.

Beverly has  sustained her business  through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a married woman with 3 children who works hard to support her family.   She has had a charcoal business for 3 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 57-year-old married woman with eight children, two attend school. Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Rosa has run a general store for 10 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Argely is 16 years old and is the second of the three children in the family. Her mother, Annabelle, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Argely is studying for a Bachelor of Elementary Education degree and is currently in the first of this four-year course.

Annabelle is borrowing PHP 11,150 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Argely for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Argely plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Felicima

texts.en:
Felicima is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Felicima is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Felicima has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc., for her business.

Analyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc., for her business

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a 54-year-old woman from Noramarg village, in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two sons, daughter in law and two little grandchildren. 

Karine and her husband run their farm. While rearing animals and cultivating different type of crops, they sell the gathered harvest in local markets and form income for the family's living. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. Since the cattle breeding is profitable, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

Karine asks this loan to purchase two pigs and two oxen to enlarge the farm and earn more income for her family's living.
 
As this is Karine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Karine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs and two oxen to enlarge the farm and earn more income for the family's living

loans.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
Hilda es una joven madre de 30 años quien vive junto a sus dos hijas en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, es una señora muy trabajadora, el motor para ello son sus hijas, ya que a pesar de no tener a su padre ella ha sido muy responsable dándoles la educación y lo necesario para sacarlas adelante.
Desde hace varios años aprendió costura, luego con unos pequeños ahorros pudo comprarse una máquina, y es así que desde hace 2 años ella presta el servicio de maquilada de prendas. Trabaja desde su propia casa, ella se encarga de darle los acabados finales a las vestimentas que le envían de fábricas. Comenta que le ha ido muy bien, pero a veces no puede recibir trabajos porque le hace falta una maquina muy esencial para su desempeño diario, es una maquina overlock. Por ello con este crédito la podrá comprar para ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio y estar siempre con sus hijas.
Agradece a la institución y a Kiva por apoyar a crecer en el negocio. Con las mejoras de las ventas podrá seguir dándoles la educación  a sus pequeñas.
texts.en: Hilda is a young 30 year old mother who lives with her two daughters in the city of Santo Domingo. She is a hard working woman, and the motivating force for her are her daughters, because even though they do not have their father,  she has been very responsible providing their education and all the necessary means to help them get ahead. Several years ago she learned to sew, and with her small savings she was able to buy a sewing machine. For the past two years she has offered her services sewing clothing. She works from home, and she is responsible for providing the finishing touches to the clothing received from factories. She stated that its is going very well, but that at times she cannot accept some jobs because she doesn't have an essential machine to work daily, which is an overlock sewing machine. With this loan,  she will be able to buy it and will grow her business little by little, and will be close to her daughters. She thanks the institution for helping her grow her business. With the sales growth she will be able to provide an education to her girls.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine to give a better finish to her clothing, and to provide a better quality of life to her daughters.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en:
Omer is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Hargiesa. He finished University in 2014 and studied accounting and works in his own shop.

He requests $500 USD from Kaaba to buy sugar, rice, flour, and soft soda drinks.

Omer will make monthly repayments. In the future Omer wants to expand his shop.

loans.use: to expand his shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a  61-year-old married woman with 5 children  who lives in Bacoor, Cavite. She and her husband work hard to provide for their daily life and  support their children's  education. 

Angelina operates a tricycle service and has a small general store. Her  husband drives the tricycle and can carry up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Cavite, a tricycle is a common means of transportation.   Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle  to market, church, a friend’s homes, destinations within their community and from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP a day.

She is requesting 40,000 PHP  to pay for tires and maintenance. She is positive that this will boost her income.

Angelina hopes to buy another tricycle unit to improve her income. She wants her children to go to college and finish their schooling. She faithfully meets weekly  with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work  and draws strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase tires and maintain her  tricycle.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 59 years old and married.

She has grown rice for 10 years and is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income operating a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
A $ 800.00 loan will be used by Edina to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt,milk, water, biscuits, fish and candles.

She opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $ 100.00. The kiosk generates a good income.
She has been thinking about running a big business after her years of experience with the kiosk.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, biscuits, fish and candles.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a 25-year-old single lady who has been working as a secretary in a dental clinic since 2011. She is working hard to develop her secretarial skills to increase her limited salary income and improve her life.

Rachelle is preparing for her wedding day, and since her income is barely enough to pay for the increasing wedding needs, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for the necessary wedding expenses to make her dream of making her own family come true.

She hopes that in the future she can afford to open her own clothes selling shop.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary wedding expenses to make her dream of making her own family come true

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42 year old married man living with his wife and three young children, who are still attending school. He is the main source of income for the family. He has his own business as an electrician and he works in parallel in a company to fulfill his family needs. 

Due to the hard financial situation, Ali is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s school fees. His only purpose is to ensure them high educational levels to help them to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 38 años se dedica a esa actividad de la cual ha podido salir adelante,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicida, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 56 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She makes her living growing corn, beans, and sorghum. She has been doing this for 38 years and it has allowed her to keep going. She is requesting a loan to buy herbicide, manure, seeds, and fertilizers in order to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, manure, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Francisca is 49 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Francisca has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more used clothing to resell.

Francisca has been in this business for two years. In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and married with one child.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, beer, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Sayat Nova village in the Ararat region.  She lives there with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 
She is a farmer and cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, garlic and grass and sells the gathered harvest in local markets.
 
The loan Ruzanna applied for is to pay for a new agro machine for cutting the grass. 

As this is Ruzanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Ruzanna get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for a new agro machine for cutting the grass

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 60 years old and married with two children. 

Imelda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Qutaibah

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Qutaibah. He is married and has two children, both of whom are school-going children. In 2010, Qutaibah established his provisions business selling sweet and cakes. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 400 JD every month from this business. 

He requested a new loan in order to purchase supplies and tools to make sweets and cakes, and also to do good promotion of his shop. In the future, Qutaibah plans to provide quality education for his children and reinvest in and expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and tools to make sweets and cakes, and also to promote his shop

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem is a 54 years old farmer and a married woman with eight children. She has been a farmer since 1979. Three of her children are garment workers and two are students. Her husband is a 55-year-old construction worker.  All of them reside in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They can earn $28 per day. 

Rem would like to apply for a loan to purchase a computer and pay the tuition fees for her son. With this loan, she will be able to help her son to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland to cultivate, renovate her house and support her youngest child to go to university.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and pay college tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase window frames and glass for repairs to her house and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, iron, and to pay for the labor to repair her daughter's bedroom wall.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es: Don Pedro de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 30 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is 60 years old and lives in his own house along with his wife. He has worked cultivating staple grains for the last 30 years. He trades his products in different markets nearby his house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, and pest controls among others, and improve his land, which is shown in the picture. This way he will be able to continue with his work and improve his incomes.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, and pest controls among others, and improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: bricks, aluminum sheets, iron, cement, sand and labor payments for the construction of the space for the kitchen.

loans.name: Diaraton  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DIARATON II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 54 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOYAN, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  LALA, 1ère personne debout de la    droite vers la     gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de TOYAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “DIARATON II” are married women, who average 54 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in TOYAN, a village in SANANKOROBA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 5th farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown is millet, as is the case with LALA, standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TOYAN. She plans on making an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Diaraton  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DIARATON I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 54 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOYAN un des villages de BOUGOULA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  DJELIKA , 1ère personne assise de la   gauche vers la    droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de DOUBAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “DIARATON I” are married women, who average 54 years of age and three children each, all living in polygamous families in TOYAN, a village in BOUGOULA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3rd farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown is millet, as is the case with DJELIKA, sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in DOUBAN. She plans on making an average profit of 80,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, 26, is married with two children, one of whom is in school. For three years, Alice has raised pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), to buy feed and supplies for her pigs. Alice has borrowed one other time from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Alice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and  supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en: Basilides is a widow with eight children and a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 59 years old, and one of her children is in school. Basilides has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Basilides would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight bags of flour and 20 litres of cooking oil

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SIKORO, un des villages de TIELE, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  SATA, 1ère personne debout  de la  droite  vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SIKORO, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI I” are married women, who average 52 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in SIKORO, a village in TIELE (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 2nd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SATA, standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in SIKORO. She plans on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SIKORO, un des villages de TIELE, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MONDJE, personne assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SIKORO, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  70.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “BENKADI II” are married women, who average 51 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in SIKORO, a village in TIELE (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 2nd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with MONDJE, sitting in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in SIKORO. She plans on making an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: windows, cement, sand, squared timber and labor for the installation of the roof and windows.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman with three children and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Florence has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes clothing for men and women. In addition she also sells poultry. Florence has requested a 40,000 KES loan from Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance Trust, to purchase cloth and thread for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr:
Mère de famille de 46 ans, mariée, Rosette est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse. Elle exerce son commerce 7jours sur 7jours. Elle vend un peu de tout: des jouets, des couverts, des matériels de coiffure, des petits quincailleries, etc..., et ceci pour attirer et satisfaire les clients. Elle était dans ce métier depuis 2002.
Son objectif est de développer son activité: augmenter les quantités des articles ou ustensiles déjà existants et en ajouter d'autres, renforcer les fonds et capital pour pouvoir ouvrir au final un grand magasin général.
Son époux travaille mais son revenu ne suffit pas à soutenir la famille, de plus, ils ont encore un enfant à charge qui fréquente encore l'école.
texts.en: 46-year-old married mother Rosette is a resourceful and hard-working woman. She works every single day of the week. She sells a little bit of everything: toys, cutlery, hair styling items, little trinkets... All in order to satisfy her customers. She has been doing this since 2002. Her goal is to further develop her business by increasing the quantity of wares and utensils she already stocks and adding others, as well as strengthening her business funds so she can one day open a large general store of her own. Her husband also works but his income alone isn't enough to support the family. What's more, they have one child living in their care who is still currently receiving an education.

loans.use: to purchase toys, cups, plates, hair straighteners and food processors

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила молодая женщина проживающая в сельской местности. Ей 31 год, она  замужем и имеет на 3 детей. Муж Чамилы работает в России на частной стройке подсобным рабочим.  Тех денег, что он отправляет не хватает для того, чтобы обеспечивать семью.  Сама Чамила вот уже на протяжении 9 лет занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Она покупает молодняк и откармливает несколько месяцев,  потом продает за более высокую цену. Это является основным источником дохода для ее семьи, благодаря своему бизнесу ее семья обеспеченна и ни в чем не нуждается. Чамила хочет, чтобы ее дети смогли получить достойное образование и работать по специальности, а не мучатся как родители. На данный момент у Чамилы возникли трудности в бизнесе, она не может продать скот из-за низкой цены. Ей нужно закупить корм для скота и с этой проблемой она решила обратиться в «АРВАНД» за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги она хочет закупить корм для скота и воспользовавшись моментом заодно закупить молодой скот по низкой цене.
texts.en: Jamila is a young woman who lives in a rural area. She is 31, married, and has three children. Her husband works on private construction projects in Russia. The money he sends home is not enough to support his family. Jamila has been raising small livestock for nine years already. She buys young animals and fattens them for a few months, then sells them for a higher price. This is the main source of income for her family. Thanks to her business, her family is provided for and lacks nothing. Jamila wants her children to be able to get a decent education and become professionals, not to struggle like their parents. At the moment Jamila is having business difficulties because she cannot sell livestock due to low prices. She needs to buy feed, so she applied for a loan with Arvand for financial support. She wants to use the money to buy livestock feed and at the same time take advantage of the market to buy young animals at a low price.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old Palestinian refugee, who works hard to improve his scrap business. He has run it since 2006 and has eight years of experience. As a refugee, he didn't have the chance to choose his own business, since most Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon have limited access to several business, so they find themselves surrendering to the fact that it is either this business or nothing else.

Currently, Mohamad's business is not located in a single region. Instead, he moves all around the nearby villages to find his scrap which is important for increasing his capital and business income at the same time.

He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his scrap capital and develop his business in a well managed way to make sure he can support his family and improve their living. Mohamad's main aim is to support his family and develop their living in a well managed way hoping that one day he can move his house outside the refugee camp.

He hopes to stay capable of educating his children so that they can benefit from a better future.

loans.use: to increase his scrap capital and develop his business in a well managed way to make sure he can support his family and improve their living.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  08 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SIKORO, un des villages de TIELE, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  OUMOU, 1ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SIKORO, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group “BENKADI III” are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in SIKORO, a village in TIELE (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 2nd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with OUMOU, standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in SIKORO. She plans on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en:
Pablina is fond of handicraft making. At the age of 64 and with nine children, she makes handicrafts as her business to provide for her children's needs.

Pablina aims to have a better life for her family, She is taking a loan to purchase more materials for her handicraft making business so that she can make more products to sell and create more sales to come up with a greater income.

Pablina plan to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her handicraft making business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Yerevan town. She lives with her husband and two children (8 and 5 years old). She is involved in providing translation and paper writing work. Mostly, Hasmik receives her orders from students. She asks for this loan now to purchase a new laptop. The current one she owns is damaged and it is difficult for Hasmik to work.

Hasmik's loan has been approved as a start up loan.
The start-up loan program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hasmik hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her business.

loans.use: to pay for a new laptop needed for writing term papers and translation.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les  07 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’PANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec   AWANI, 1ère personne  assise de la  gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 5th farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are:  peanuts and rice, as is the case with AWANI, sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain:  0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers at the market. She plans on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is encouraged that she was granted a 20000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts, accessories and maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10000 PHP loan for her to pay for the tire replacement and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Renalyn hopes to grow her business and acquire another unit of tricycle to improve her income.  She prays that all her children will finish their schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Hojiniso

texts.en:
Hojiniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996 and now is living in a remote district with her family. She is married but has no children yet. Her husband is a constructor so he renovates houses. 

She is a business woman and sews traditional women's dresses and has regular clients.  Recently she has had the additional activity of sewing national decoration embroidering on pillows and blankets. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine to expand her production. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to expand her sewing and embroidery business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 36 years old and married with one child. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like miniral water, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for 3 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like miniral water, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Gnintaga Group

texts.fr: Sibirihan, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Cette brave dame vend du céréales et des balais au prix en gros et cela fait 5 ans. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour aller dans les villages environnant pour s'approvisionner afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Sibirihan a des clients qui achètent sa marchandise pour revendre en détail à leur tour dans les différents marchés. Elle est bien connue dans son quartier et est aussi accueillante, c'est ce qui fait sa force. Après ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille tout en continuant son activité.
texts.en: Sibirihan, the representative member, is a married mother of three. This good and honest lady has been selling brooms at wholesale prices for five years. She has need of this loan to go to nearby villages to supply herself, so as to satisfy her customers. Sibirihan has customers who purchase her merchandise to resell at the retail level at the various market of theirs. She is well-known in her district and is also accommodating, which is the reason for her strength. After her sales, her profit will enable her to take care of her family while continuing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains and brooms to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a party supplies business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more party supplies to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more party supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sabougnouma I Group

texts.fr:

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le riz avec HAWA, 2ème personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iii Group

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec TERENA,1ère personne  debout de la    gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme III group are married women, who average 40 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Nanguila, one of the villages in Niangadina in Mali's second administrative region. They work together with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to run their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fifth seasonal loan with the institution. 

Terena, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows rice. With her loan she is planning on buy inputs and seeds, as well as paying for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the market to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 75,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to cover labor costs and the purchase of inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 48 years old, married and has two children. To help her husband, who is a fisherman, she does banana production, to earn an income in providing for her family. As a mother, she wants what is the best for her family, so she took a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana farm, to produce good quality bananas and to be able to satisfy all the orders in the market.  It will also create more income.

Nelfa plan for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are attending school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rowena has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married, and has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high costs of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for resale

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  4 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NANGUILA, un des villages de NIANGADINA 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz avec NAGNOUMANI,1ère personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The four members of the Djiguisseme IV group are married women, who average 42 years of age with three children each; they all live in polygamous families in Nanguila, one of the villages in Niangadina in Mali's second administrative region. They work together with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to run their farming activities successfully during the winter season. They are on their fifth seasonal loan with the institution. 

Nagnoumani, who is standing on the far left of the photo, grows rice. With her loan she is planning on buy inputs and seeds, as well as paying for labor to maintain 0.25 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce is sold in the market to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. She expects to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also help out her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and purchase inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  09 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DRAKORO DOUMBA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le riz avec TENINKO, 1ère personne  assise de la   gauche vers la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.

The nine members of the group “SABOUGNOUMA III” are married women, who average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in DRAKORO DOUMBA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 5th farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are:  peanuts, millet, and rice, as is the case with TENINKO, sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 1.5 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers at the market. She plans on making an average profit of 1,300,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.en:
Ra'nogul is a 28-year-old seamstress and a skilled craftswoman.  She has been sewing women's clothes for the past four years.  Her dream has always been to become a dressmaker, as she loves to design and sew clothes.  Thanks to her experience, she can easily sew several outfits in one day. 

Ra'nogul is divorced from her husband; she lives with her father, mother and her brothers.  Her brothers are involved in retail business and home renovations.  Beside sewing, Ra'nogul also works as a cook in a hospital cafeteria.  She is an independent woman.  She now wants to expand her sewing activity.  She is taking a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda is a careful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974 and lives in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. She is a hardworking and strong woman. After graduation from university she got married. 

Unfortunately, her husband got sick. Her husband worked and supported her family, but now Mahsuda needs to work to feed her family. She has work at a secondary school. 

She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay for treatment for her husband in hospital, where he needs expensive medicines. She hopes Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to treat her husband in hospital

loans.name: Walaa'

texts.en:
Walaa’ is 35 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Gaza. She has been working at a society for deaf children for five years, but her husband lost his business after the war.

Today, Walaa’ is requesting this loan because she needs support after the Gaza war. Her house was destroyed, so she wants to rebuild it. As a start, she wants to buy building materials and pay for the workers to start work.

One of her biggest dreams is to see her children grow and to give them the best education so that they can become professionals. This loan will help her to improve the house conditions for her family. She is grateful to everyone who helps her to start this step.

loans.use: to rebuild her house; as a start, she wants to buy building materials and pay for the workers to start work.

loans.name: Hussin

texts.en:
Hussin is 48 years old and lives with his extended family of 17, with his several children attending  the public primary school in Gaza. He has been working as a construction worker for 18 years.
 
He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to rebuild it again, so he trying now to take the first step so he can return to a normal life. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan to build walls and ceilings, as a start, then he would like to install pipelines.  He needs to buy building materials for rebuilding his home. 

Hussin is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to rebuild his house that was destroyed in the war that affected Gaza and be able to return to a normal family life

loans.name: Djiguisseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NANGUILA, un des villages de NIANGADINA 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is thankful that he was granted a 25000 PHP loan which he used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in his general store. Through his earnings he is able to send his child to school and meet their daily living expense.

He would now like to apply for a 25000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, which he sells at retail. He is positive that more items will yield more sales and thus increase his earnings. His business earnings is a stable source to sustain his family's basic needs and for the education of his child. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. 

Saturnino dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give his child the best education possible to allow him better opportunities in life. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Fabolona  I Group

texts.fr:

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth, colored threads, needles, sequins and pearls for embroidery work by herself

loans.name: Narcis Alain

texts.fr:
Narcis Alain est un père de famille travailleur et responsable, très fier de sa petite famille. Il a 42 ans, et a deux enfants, qui sont tous scolarisés (12 et 16 ans). 
Les deux époux exploitent ensemble l'activité source de revenu de la famille: il s'agit d'une exploitation de gargote, il y a maintenant 10 ans. C'était son frère qui lui a initié l'idée car auparavant, il était agent de sécurité et puis receveur de taxi-bus. Il a une bonne attitude commerciale, et accueillant.
Il demande un crédit pour acheter un congélateur et pour recarreler le dallage du gargote. Le but de la réhabilitation et l'investissement est pour fidéliser les anciens clients et pour en tirer des nouveaux, mais aussi pour travailler dans un endroit sain et bien équipé.
La famille habite dans une maison encore en location et envisage d'acheter un bout de terrain et y construire une petite maison.
texts.en:
Narcis Alain is a hardworking and responsible father, who is very proud of his small family. He is 42 years old and has two children who are both at school (12 and 16 years old). The married couple runs the activity which generates the family's income together; it is a small cafe that they have been running for ten years now. It was Narcis Alain's brother who gave him the idea to do this, as beforehand he was a security guard and then a taxi-bus conductor. He has a good commercial spirit and is very welcoming.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a freezer and retile the floor of the café. The aim of the refurbishment and this investment is to retain his existing customers' loyalty and bring in new customers, but also to be able to work in a hygenic and well equipped place. The family still lives in a rented house, but he is planning to buy a piece of land and build a small house.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and floor tiles.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 49-year-old married Palestinian Refugee, a father of six children, who has worked hard as a fisherman for thirty years to provide them with the necessary living needs.  Jamal lives in a refugee camp, where they suffer from the lack of several necessary living needs and he works hard to make his family's living better. His income is barely enough to cover his family's increasing living needs.  

Thus for this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a van which he will use to start a new transportation-based business through providing transportation services to students inside the camp.

He is longing to improve his family's income, and hopes to provide them with a better living.

loans.use: To buy a van which he will use to start a new transportation based business through providing transportation services to students inside the camp

loans.name: Saima Group

texts.en:
A mother of a child living in Lahore,Pakistan, Samia is 40 years old. To struggle with the family’s hardship, her husband earns an income driving a rickshaw and working for others for a fee to earn more income. 

She is taking a loan by helping her husband to buy a new rickshaw. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle. And is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Ruziqul

texts.ru: Рузикул трудолюбивый и жизнерадостный мужчина.  Ему 64-года. Он женат. Заботливый отец двоих детей. Любимый дед шестерых внуков. Рузикул вырос в сельской местности. Хоть он родился и вырос в селе. Он очень любил учиться. Его любовь к учебе привела его  в педагогическое училище. Получив диплом, он стал преподавателем биологии. Проработал в школе 25 лет. Сейчас он пенсионер. Гайбулло очень энергичный мужчина. Не может сидеть дома без дела сложа руки. Поэтому он решил заняться бизнесом. Купил крупно рогатый скот, откармливал и перепродал. Занявшись этим бизнесом он получил немалый доход. Но полученный доход Рузикул тратил на покупку корма для скота. Поэтому для покупки скота у него не хватили денежных средств. И чтобы увеличить поголовье своего скота он обратился в МДО Арванд  за кредитом. Получив кредит он увеличит поголовья своего скота. Приносит благодарность Арванду за поддержку и выручку.
texts.en: Ruziqul is a hardworking man with a positive attitude toward life.  He is 64 years old, married, the caring father of two children and the beloved grandfather of six grandchildren.  Ruziqul was born and grew up in the countryside.  He has always had a passion for learning, which led him to study at a pedagogical institute.  After graduation, he became a biology teacher and worked in a school for 25 years.  Today, Ruziqul is retired but still very active.  He can't just sit at home and do nothing.  For this reason, he decided to start his own business.  He recently bought some cattle, fattened his animals up and sold them again.  Thanks to this activity, he made quite a good income.  However, he has spent his earnings to buy animal feed and he currently doesn't have enough money to buy additional cattle.  In order to increase his cattle headcount, he has therefore turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan.  This loan will allow him to increase the size of his herd.  He expresses his gratitude toward MDO Arvand for their assistance and support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nadjara Allaye  Iii Group

texts.fr:
