loans.name: Tomasa Julia

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 12 años y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Cutusuma’ ubicado en la costa sud oriental del lago sagrado Titikaka, los habitantes del lugar se dedican a la agricultura y pesca. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Tomasa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la ganadería y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y ayudan en la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construido de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal; ella se encarga de producir leche bajo las normas exigidas en una explotación ganadera lechera, y espera lograr una producción diaria entre 4 y 6 litros por vaca, dependiendo si es criolla o mejorada, “inicié mi negocio vendiendo toda la producción de leche fresca, posteriormente perfeccioné mis procesos y la transformé en queso...” comenta. La venta la realiza al menudeo ofertando en cada domicilio de su comunidad y a visitantes o turistas. La ventaja de su negocio es que los quesos del lugar tienen gran demanda en la ciudad, la desventaja es la falta de leche para incrementar la producción. Su sueño es mejorar su producción quesera para vender en la ciudad, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción de leche. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar la producción de leche y vender queso en la ciudad
texts.en:
Tomasa, 38, is married and has 2 children: 12- and 8-years old, respectively.  She is a good mom, enterprising, responsible and very hard-working.  She has her own business making and selling cheese.  She started the business at her house in Cutusuma, a small town on the southeast coast of Lake Titicaca.  Fishing and agriculture are common occupations for the people here.  The local climate is cold and dry and average daily temperatures range from 0- to 12-degrees, Centigrade, or 32- to 54-degrees, Fahrenheit.
Tomasa is brown-skinned and has brown eyes and long black hair that she wears braided.  She wears traditional clothing (sombrero, woven sweater) and speaks both Aymará, her native language, and Spanish.  She lives with her husband, a farmer and cattleman, and her children, both of whom are in school.  The children help their parents tend the family's land and animals.  The family house is made of bricks, cement and adobe and has a metal roof and brick floors.  The house has electricity and water that the family pumps from their own well.  
Tomasa keeps dairy cows that produce the milk she needs to make cheese.  The milk is produced according to strict requirements for milk production and each cow produces between 4 and 6 liters of milk per day.  "When I first started, I was selling the milk that I produced, but as I learned the business I graduated to cheese-making", she says.  She sells her product to locals, visitors and tourists.  She advantage of cheese-making is that there is a lot of demand for handmade cheeses here.  Tomasa's problem is that she can't increase her cheese production because she doesn't have the milk she needs to do so.  She wants to sell cheese in the city, but she needs more dairy cattle to produce the milk she needs to increase her cheese production.  
Tomasa has operated her business for 15 years and she is applying for this loan, her first, to buy more dairy cattle.  The investment will allow her to increase her milk production and, in turn, make and sell more cheese.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle for her cheese-making business.

loans.name: Fouroutono Group

texts.fr: Assita est la responsable de ce groupe de 5 membres formé de femmes dynamiques qui se battent au quotidien pour assurer un avenir à leurs enfants. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants scolarisés. Cette brave dame vend des marchandises diverses( pagnes, mèches, charbon, bois) et cela depuis 20 ans. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 2 douzaines de pagnes et aussi des mèches pour vendre. Après ses ventes son bénéfice lui permettra de s’occuper de ses enfants et de continuer ses activités.
texts.en: Assita is the official of this group of five members composed of energetic women, who struggle each day to ensure a future for their children. Assita is a married mother of six children, who are in school. For twenty years, this good and honest lady has been selling diverse goods: 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), hair extensions, charcoal. She has need of this loan to purchase 2 dozen lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth and also some hair extensions to sell. After her sales, her profit will enable her to take care of her children and to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and hair extensions to resell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 03 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, esto con la finalidad de dar una mejor calidad de servicio a sus pasajeros lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old and in a common-law relationship. He lives in the family house in a rural part of the district of Oyotún. It is a community where the inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

He works offering public transport services. He has been doing this for more than 3 years so he has experience in the business. He has good references on the part of the inhabitants of the district. He is requesting a loan to have repairs and maintenance done on his vehicle that currently is in poor condition. He is doing this in order to provide a higher quality service to his passengers which will allow him to increase the level of his income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to have repairs and maintenance done on his vehicle that currently is in poor condition.

loans.name: 14 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE JUNIO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta y elaboración de muebles, chompas de lana, venta de zapatos, venta de salchipapa, venta de chamarras y venta de comida.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que es hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia con el primer crédito que saco en la institución hace cuatro años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la fabricación, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The 14 De Junio communal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamerican regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Candelaria is the president.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied and include making and selling furniture, wool sweaters, selling shoes, selling ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with hot dog], selling jackets, and selling food.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Candelaria is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business of making and selling furniture.  She says that she learned this business on her own initiative with the first loan that she got from the institution four years ago.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wood wholesale) that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  After making the furniture, she will sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially.  She is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is a 33-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erlina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Erlina requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, spices, and other materials for her food production business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil, spices, and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya is 57 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lidya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and personal care products. 

In the future, Lidya would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter 54 years old, is married to Eunice and supports 6 children. 

He is a small scale farmer earning an income of 10,000 KES per month.

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and seeds to improve his farming. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve his family's living standards. 

His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and seeds to improve his farming.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive el señor Julio Cesar, tiene 66  años de edad y  es divorciado,  tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Viven en casa propia.
Don Julio Cesar hace 25 años compro un taxi en una cooperativa, el aprovecha sus conocimientos de chofer profesional y realiza fletes dentro y fuera de la ciudad, un hijo es quien le ayuda ya que también es chofer profesional hacen turnos y así brindar un buen servicio de taxi. Trabaja todos los días  de lunes a sábados y a veces los feriados o cuando requieren de sus servicios. 
Este crédito es para pagar la reparación y mantenimiento del taxi.  Lleva  5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and most visited seaside resort in Ecuador because of it's beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the largest deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

Julio Cesar lives in this place. He is 66 years old, divorced and has four children, all adults and independent. He lives in his own house.

Twenty five years ago Julio Cesar bought a taxi in a cooperative. He takes advantage of his experience as a professional driver and he makes deliveries within and outside the city. A son helps him and is also a professional driver. He takes shifts and so the y provide a good taxi service. Julio works every day fro Monday to Saturday and sometimes on holidays or when his services are required.

This loan is to pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi. He has been in the communal bank for 5 years and he likes it as the interest rates are low. His dream is to own a new taxi.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive el señor Rene, tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 23, 19 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en la universidad, colegio y escuela. Viven en casa propia. Su esposa es ama de casa.
Don Rene hace 20 años compro un taxi en una cooperativa, el es chofer profesional y da el servicio de taxi dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días  de lunes a sábados y a veces los feriados o cuando requieren de sus servicios. Es así como mantiene su hogar y los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para pagar la reparación y mantenimiento del taxi y para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos. Lleva 1 año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos. Su sueño es tener un taxi nuevo.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular, and highly visited resort town in Ecuador because of its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first port to the deep waters of Ecuador and South America.

Rene, age 47, lives in this place.  He is married, and they have three children; ages 23, 19, and 11.  The children attend the university, high school, and elementary school.  They live in their own house.  His wife is a housewife.

Twenty years ago Rene bought a taxi in a cooperative.  He is a professional driver, and he provides taxi service within and outside of the city.  He works every day from Monday through Saturday and sometimes on holidays or when his services are needed.  This way he maintains his household and pays for his children’s educational expenses.

This loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his taxi and to buy school supplies for his children.

He has been in his loan group for one year, and he likes it because the interest is low.  His dream is to have a new taxi.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his taxi and to buy school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 60-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber for her business.

Irene has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber for her business.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lalyn is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish and other supplies for her fish vending business.

Lalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and other supplies for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Ángela Fidelina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo de 6 años de edad que estudia en la escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Ángela se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y también trabaja como profesora en una escuela ya que es ella Lcda. Docente, trabaja por las mañanas de Lunes a Viernes en la escuela y en la venta trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la tarde ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y que esto lo viene realizando desde hace ocho años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar blusas, vestidos, jeans y otras prendas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 8 años y le gusta porque es fácil de acceder y rápido sin tantos documentos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is thought to be the most popular seaside vacation spot in Ecuador.  The city has beautiful beaches and one of the most important deep-water ports in South America.  
Ángela, 38, lives in Manta.  She is a single mother with a 6-year old son who is now in school.  They live with her parents.  Ángela has a business buying and selling clothes.  She buys clothes from catalogs and resells the merchandise to her customers.  She is also a licensed teacher and works at a local school.  She works at the school in the mornings and manages her business in the afternoons.  She prefers to work at her business in the afternoons, she says, because it is easier to get around then.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She has operated her business for 8 years and loves selling.  She has lots of regular customers now.  
Ángela is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise she needs--blouses, dresses, jeans and other clothing pieces--to carry on her business.  She has been a member of her community bank for 8 years and says that she likes how quickly they process her loans.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 64 años de edad, es casada, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, entre otros, tiene 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para incrementar el stock de su negocio, lo que le permitirá crecer en ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Julia is 64 years old, married, and lives with her family in the Oyotun district, where the population is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and cattle raising. Oyotun is located in Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

Maria Julia sells groceries such as milk, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and carbonated drinks, among other items. She has 10 years experience in the business and can count on a fixed set of customers who offer very good personal and work references for her. 

Maria Julia has solicited a loan to purchase a larger quantity of products in order to increase her store's inventory. This will allow the business to expand its sales and, thus, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of products and increase her business's inventory.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora María Del Carmen, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años que estudian en escuela. El cónyuge es pescador.
Doña María Del Carmen para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, carteras y zapatos,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana por las mañanas ya que se le hace más fácil hacer sus recorridos, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 3 años  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar carteras, zapatos, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y vestidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 ciclos  y le gusta porque el grupo es unido. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular and most visited seaside resort in Ecuador because of it's beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the largest deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

María Del Carmen lives in this place. She is 31 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has two children aged 9 and 7 years old who go to school. Her partner is a fisherman.

In order to get head María Del Carmen works selling all types of clothing, purses and shoes. Her form of selling is door-to-door and she also sells at her house where she has a small stand. She works three days a week in the mornings as this is the easiest time for her to make her rounds. She sells on credit to her clients and collects every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil every 15 days or month to buy her merchandise depending on her needs. She has been doing this for 3 years and thing are going well.

She will use this loan to buy purses, shoes, pants, blouses, t-shirts and dresses. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and she likes it as the group is very united. Her dream is for her children to become professionals and to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy purses, shoes, pants, blouses, t-shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Roxana Maribel

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretera Olmos - Corral quemado lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante el comercio de alimentos preparados y agricultura, perteneciente a la Provincia de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega donde ofrece la venta de abarrotes como arroz, menestras, aceite, azúcar, leche, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con muy buenas referencias en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana, age 43, lives with her husband in a rural area in the San Felipe district.  She lives in a community that is located along the Olmos Corral - Quemado highway, which has permitted development through trade of prepared foods and farming. It is in the Jaén province in the northern highlands of Peru.

Roxana has a store where she sells groceries like rice, soup, cooking oil, sugar, milk, and other products.  She has experience in this business and very good references in her district.

She has requested a loan to buy a greater quantity of groceries to stock her business.  This way she will generate greater income for her family, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables and condiments needed in her food stall business. Aside from her food stall she also has a general store. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for 40,000 PHP which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like canned goods, rice, instant noodles, biscuits, beverages, toiletries and mineral water as well to sell at her general store. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Alicia hopes to grow her businesses so she could buy their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, toiletries and mineral water to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cereals for sale in the market so as to meet client needs for food supply.

loans.name: Mageline

texts.en:
Mageline works hard to support her family. She is married with five children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Mageline has been in this business for 28 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale on behalf of 10 families and to raise funds for Church programs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle and fodder for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него очень дружная семья. Живут они в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход в семье, все члены семьи пытаются как-то зарабатывать деньги. Каждый трудится как может. Основным и стабильным бизнесом Абдурауф является животноводство. Он разводит и продаёт скот. В этом деле ему помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт полученное от скота молоко. Бизнес животноводства приносит Абдурауф хороший и стабильный доход. Поэтому он желает расширить этот бизнес. Ему необходимо купить ещё несколько голов скота для выращивания и дальнейшей продажи. Для этого Абдурауф обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он надеется, что этот бизнес будет успешно расширяться и приносить больше прибыли, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды семьи. Абдурауф заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abdurauf is a cheerful 30-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has a very tight-knit family. They live in a rural location. In order to have income for the family, all of the members of the family try to earn money somehow. Each works as he can. Abdurauf's main and stable business is rearing animals. He breeds and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this work. She looks after the cattle, and also sells the milk they get from them. The animal rearing business gives Abdurauf a good and stable income, so he wants to expand this business. He needs to buy several more heads of cattle to raise and resell in the future. For this Abdurauf has turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy the cattle. He hopes that this business will expand successfully and bring more profits in order to satisfy the needs of the family well. Abdurauf thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Musalam

texts.en: Musalam is a kind woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has children. She has many years of practice doing business. Recently she does business of buying and selling household goods. She gains a profitable income from her business. Her brothers help and support her in business. However, the assortment of her goods is finishing, but she does not have money to buy additional goods. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to buy household goods for her store. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy household goods for her store.

loans.name: Sokhuon

texts.en:
Sokhuon, 32, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one child. To make a living and to support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sesame and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers at a market. So far, she has been in this business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en: Thuraya is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children who are all attending school. She is working hard to help her husband so they both become capable of satisfying their family needs and wants. She has owned a Pastry Shop since 2006 in her town, and she feels happy with what she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new oven to be able to grow and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a new oven

loans.name: Ork

texts.en: Ork, 38, is a married woman and lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who live under her support. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of farmland that is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this business for around twenty years. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 5.00 per day.The current farmland that she owns is small, and it can provide less benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area, but she cannot afford it. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living condition. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 46-year-old mother of four children who is married to a farmer. Since 2010 she has been working from her home making and selling traditional Lebanese kechek, or kishk, a fermented and dried mixture of milk, yogurt and bulgur which stores well. The excellent quality of her kechek has earned her a good reputation in her hometown.

Samia is requesting today a 1,575,000 LBP loan through Kiva's field partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy more kechek ingredients so she can increase production and her income by a good percentage. She hopes that in the near future she might be able to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy more kechek ingredients

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz,  tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, uno mayor de edad e independiente y 4 son de 19, 13, 11 y 8 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Cruz es se dedica a la venta de productos Omnilife,  vende multivitamínicos, suplementos alimenticios y productos de línea de belleza. Trabaja de lunes a viernes cinco horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cuatro años con esta actividad y le va muy bien. 
Este crédito es para invertir en productos Omnilife `para la salud. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace dos años y le gusta porque el grupo es unido y los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is thought to be the most popular seaside vacation spot in Ecuador. The city has beautiful beaches and one of the most important deep-water ports in South America.
Sra. Cruz, 51, lives in Manta.  She is married and has 5 children, the oldest of whom lives away now.  Her four younger children, 19-, 13-, 11-, and 8-years old, respectively, are in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  Doña Cruz operates a business selling Omnilife products: multivitamins, food supplements and beauty products.  She works five hours a day, Mondays to Fridays.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects from her customers every eight days.  She has operated the business for four years and says that it is successful.  
Doña Cruz is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with Omnilife health products.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and likes it because the members support one another and because it offers low rates of interest.
For the future, Doña Cruz hopes that her children will find good, paid careers and that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to stock her health products business.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Thank you for your lives, lenders! It is a wonderful experience for Abner to finally be able to gain enough money for the maintenance of his tricycle unit previously, which is one of the basic sources of income for his family. Aside from this, he also runs a small sari-sari store business. From both the inventories, they are able to meet their daily needs. Today, both businesses are working, and the couple is able to manage the same. 

Today, he again wants to avail for himself a 40,000 PHP loan. He will use this one to buy greater stocks of supplies of grocery items for their variety store and maintain his tricycle unit as well. This is because he wants to nurture his businesses for better income of course. He indeed hopes that you will still show him your unwavering support. He will make sure to water the seed of success you planted in their lives. 

Abner wants to witness his children graduate from school someday and for their lives to go well. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and to buy greater stocks of supplies of grocery items for his variety store.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and a mother of two, and has worked in non-governmental organizations (NGO).   Fourteen years ago she suffered from a severe illness and withdrew herself from everything.  To pass the time at home she bought herself a sewing machine and made scarves and gave them to institutions for gifting purposes.  Her scarves became popular so she started selling them.  She obtained a patent for her scarves and started selling them on stands and counters.  

One of Yasemin's friends told her about microcredit opportunities.  With her first loan she purchased fabric for her scarves and she increased the quantity of her products.  With the help of her second loan she is planning to increase the quantity of her products again. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Evli iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarının okul hayatlarıyla beraber sivil toplum örgütlerinde çalışmış, 14 yıl  önce çok ciddi bir rahatsızlık geçirmiş  ve her şeyden uzaklaşarak evde vakit geçirmek amaçlı örgü makinesinde derneklere hediye amaçlı şal örmeye başlamış.  Şalları aranılır hale gelmeye başlayınca satışına başlamış ve şalların patentini alarak stantlarda ve tezgahta satışına başlamış.  Mikro kredi kullanan bir arkadaşından mikro krediyi duymuş ve mikro kredi kullandı.  Şal ipi alarak üretip satışlarını artırdı.  İkinci kredisi ile de şal ipi alarak üreterek satışlarını artırmak istiyor.
Yeni modellerde üretmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her scarves.

loans.name: Şifa

texts.en:
Şifa has one child, and her husband is deceased. After her husband's death, she had financially hard times. She started knitting at home and selling the items.

She applied for a loan. With the help of her loan, she is planning to buy yarn in bulk, make knitwear for babies, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şifa hanım bir çocuk annesi eşi vefat etmiş. Eşinin vefatından sonra maddi açıdan zor günler geçirmiş. Evde yaptığı örgüleri satarak para kazanmaya başlamış, mikro kredinin imkanlarından faydalanmak istemiş ve başvurmuş. Kullandığı kredi ile örgü ipi alarak bebek ürünleri üreterek ve satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNION” iniciará el quinto  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta pipoca de maíz, cerrajería, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de jugos de frutas y venta de carne. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que es hace cuatro años integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugo de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace veinte años, adquiriendo el conocimiento por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de leche y frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The eight members of the UNION community bank are setting out on their fifth round of funding with Pro Mujer, a project of the Santiago II Center.  Sra. Faustina is the president of the group.  The group's members operate a range of businesses that include: grain sales; locksmith services; vegetables sales; clothing sales; juice sales; and meat sales.  The group is applying for a loan that will benefit small businesses here.

Sra. Faustina has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years and tells us that a friend of hers, a member before, recommended that she too join.  She has operated a juice sales business for 20 years, a business that she started on her own initiative.  

Sra. Faustina will use her share of the loan to buy wholesale supplies of milk and fruit.  She will buy the supplies from sellers in El Alto and sell the juice that she makes at her juice stand.  She is married and has four children and this investment will provide her with an income that will help to support them.

When we asked Sra. Faustina what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training and health-related services they offer.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her juice business.

loans.name: Maryvic

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maryvic works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Maryvic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other fishing materials for her business.

Maryvic has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her family. She is married with six children and has a buy and sell coconut business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut to sell.

Marisa has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to sell

loans.name: Pearl Lee

texts.en:
Pearl Lee is a 26-year-old high school graduate and lives in Pulupandan.  She is married to Bonnie, a tricycle driver. They have four children aged 7, 5, 4 and 1. The eldest is in elementary. 

Pearl Lee was working in a local fast food, but currently has a home business. Their total monthly family income of PHP 7,500 ($168 ) is not enough to provide even for their basic needs.

Thus, when Pearl Lee qualified for the two-month training program with Bagosphere, she found  a chance for her to uplift her family’s life in a few months. Pearl Lee wants to provide education and other basic needs of her family. 

To have a successful career in a BPO industry, your loan assistance might just make her reach her goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock merchandise for his retail business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in Zarqaa, Jordan. He is 20 years old and single. His father is the family's sole breadwinner, and he could not cover Mohammad`s education fees; therefore Mohammad decided to work along with  his education to be able cover his educational expenses.

He is a bachelor's degree student majoring in finance. Mohammad chose this major because it is easier to find jobs in this field.

He has been facing some financial problems that prevent him from paying his university fees and completing his studies. Therefore, he has applied for a loan to help pay for his education and complete his education.

loans.use: To help pay for his education and complete his education.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Paraíso” y está conformado por 05 socias comprometidas y responsables. Esther de 67 años de edad es separada por eso es lucho para sacar a sus hijos adelante ella sola. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de belleza. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien. Así mismo se siente feliz porque ha logrado captar más clientes lo cual ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de perfumes, talcos, labiales y rubores. El grupo “el Paraíso” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Esther es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa color marrón.
texts.en:
This is the group "El Paraíso". It is comprised of five committed and responsible members. 

Esther, age 67, is separated, which is why it is a struggle for her to get her children ahead by herself. She works selling beauty products. With a lot of effort, she has managed to improve her business, and it is going well. She is also happy because she has succeeded in attracting more customers, which has allowed her to increase her income. She will use her last loan to buy perfumes, powders, lipsticks, and blush. 

The group "El Paraíso" thanks the people of Kiva for making this loan possible. Esther is the first one on the right, and she is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, powders, lipsticks, and blush.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting, so as to get a better harvest for sale and meet client needs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 29 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Mary Ann has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 56 years old, married, and supports seven children. She is a small-scale farmer, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to increase production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve her family’s living standards.

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to increase production.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 67 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Marietta would like to save enough money expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zita is 59 years old now.

Zita has a buy-and-sell personal care products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell such as lotion, roll-on, soap, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Zita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as lotion, roll-on, soap, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Teresa has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in the market.

Teresa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Goldie

texts.en:
Goldie is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Goldie works very hard to provide for them.

Goldie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Goldie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Goldie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is 28 years old and single. Five years ago he started working as a cashier to cover his needs and expenses. He is also continuing his studies. He is a hard working ambitious man who wants to finish his studies and start building his future.

Abbass requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay his university tuition fees. This loan is very important to him for it will help him achieve his goals and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 42 years old, is married and supports four children.

He is in a retail business and has an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to set up a stable stall and add stock to his business.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards.

His hope is to better his life.

loans.use: to set up a stable stall and add stock to his business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira and her husband are farmers with 20 years' experience. They have a big and beautiful farm where they raise cattle, cultivate vegetables and crops and also run a fruit orchard. They get income from their farming, which helps them to support their living.

Elvira is asking for this loan to be able to purchase three more calves and enlarge the number of cattle on the farm. She will place the purchased calves in a barn located near the family yard. She will raise them, and after they grow, will start milking them. Elvira and her husband will start production of cheese and will sell it at the local market. As a result, the family's income will significantly increase and they will live in better conditions.

As this is Elvira's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Elvira get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for three calves to enrich the livestock and gather more milk.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Ruby is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ruby has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sabali I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABALI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAMALA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  WARABA, 2ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TAMALA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “SABALI” are married women, who average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in TAMALA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3th farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with WARABA, standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TAMALA. She plans on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Sabali Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABALI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAMALA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  AMINATA, 2ème personne assise de la  droite  vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TAMALA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the group “SABALI II” are married women, who average 42 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in TAMALA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3th farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with AMINATA, sitting second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TAMALA. She plans on making an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gemma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gemma has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 36-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents and biscuits for her son's general store.

loans.name: Sabali Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABALI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAMALA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  DJOFING, 2ème personne assise de la gauche vers la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TAMALA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “SABALI III” are married women, who average 40 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in TAMALA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3rd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with DJOFING, sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TAMALA. She plans on making an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Susan is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like bedsheets, curtains, pants, etc. for her buy-and-sell ready to wear business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bedsheets, curtains, pants, etc.

loans.name: Sabali Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  SABALI  IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAMALA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  AWA, 2ème personne assise de la  droite vers la   gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TAMALA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group “SABALI IV” are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in TAMALA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3rd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with AWA, sitting second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TAMALA. She plans on making an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Sabali V Group

texts.fr:
Les  04 membres du groupe  SABALI V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAMALA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  SALIMATA, 1ère personne assise de la   gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de TAMALA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  50.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group “SABALI V” are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in TAMALA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their 3rd farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is: peanuts, as is the case with SALIMATA, sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to retailers and consumers in TAMALA. She plans on making an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, and personal care products. She has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk she can supply to clients daily.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and supplements this income with earnings from her sugarcane farming and general store businesses.

Ronelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm. She dreams of one day being able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 54-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the necessities of life. 
As the sole breadwinner of his family, he puts forth much effort to provide them with everything they need.
For this reason, he acquired the previous Al Majmoua/Kiva loan to improve and develop his business by purchasing a new heater, an oven, trays and kettles. Those purchases helped him increase his business quality and production.

Today, Nabil has improved both his business level and standard of living. He is acquiring another loan from KIva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a water tank for his business needs. He also will use the loan to increase his business merchandise with coffee, sugar, milk and many other items.

Nabil is working toward achieving his set future plans and making sure he can respond to almost all of his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for his business needs and increase his business merchandise with coffee, sugar, milk and many other items.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja como electricista y otros oficios.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00 hasta 15h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene nueve años en esta actividad y le va muy bien. Su negocio lo inicio con capital propio y lo ha ido incrementando con los créditos de la función.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería  para la temporada escolar como: uniformes, medias y útiles escolares. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 9 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es unido. Sus sueños es seguir ayudándoles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The city of  Manta is considered to be the most visited and popular seaside resort in Ecuador thanks to its beautiful and inviting beaches. It is the first deepwater port of Ecuador and South America.

This is where Carmen lives.  She is 65 years old, married and has four grown children who live on their own. Her husband works as an electrician and at other jobs. Carmen sells all kinds of clothing door-to-door and also out of a small shop in her home. She works every day from 10:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m. She sells to her customers on credit and collects every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every 15 days or once a month, depending on what she needs. 

Carmen has been doing this for nine years and it has been going very well. She started her business with her own capital and has been adding to it with loans from the foundation. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for the coming school season, such as uniforms, socks, and school supplies. 

She has been with the Credit Group for nine years and she likes it because the group is close-knit. Her dream is to continue helping her children.

loans.use: to buy uniforms, socks and school supplies.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito is grateful that he was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in his general store. Through his earnings he is able to support himself and provide for his daily needs. 

He would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more of grocery items such as garlic and pepper which he will repack in small quantities to sell at retail. He is happy with the return on his investment since it helps cover his daily sustenance and assist his aging parents. He is thanking God and you in advance for your good heart and the financial help that will be given him. 

Lolito aims to grow his business and dreams to own a house and have his own family someday. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries items, mostly garlic, pepper, and other condiments, to sell at his small store.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 54 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care product, and other groceries

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik is from Tsoghamarg, a village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her eldest son is a army officer, and her second son serves in the military. In the region where Goharik and her husband live, the farming sector is predominant, and it is the principal source of income for the majority of the families who live there.

Goharik and her husband also run a farm. They keep livestock consisting of four cows, calves, 22 sheep and hens. As well, they cultivate wheat, barley and grass. This requested loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, fuel and seeds needed for land cultivation. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Goharik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living.

Goharik hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge her agribusiness, so her family will have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel for land cultivation, and seeds, to gather more harvest and increase her income for living

loans.name: Mission Group

texts.en:
Theophil, who is his mid 60s, is married with seven adult children.  He runs a grocery store and sells milk as well.  He has been in this business for 20 years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Theophil's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his two businesses and has managed to pay them all back successfully.  He is happy with the loan program and appreciates Kiva's support.  He has used his profit to repay loans and saved some money in his bank account while taking care of his family and covering household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy drinks for the grocery store and to increase the milk stock. He dreams of owning his own cows for milking.

Theophil will share this loan with his loan group, Mission, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and to increase the milk stock.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, 57, lives in a community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of seven children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizer and herbicide to spray her crops to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase posts and fencing wire for fencing her farm to protect her crops from livestock.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 26 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Johna is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Johna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for seven years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Johna would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jhona works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jhona is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jhona has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 34 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Maria Camille is 18 years old and is fifth of the five children in the family. Her mother, Cherry, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her livestock raising business in the Philippines.

Maria Camille is studying for the bachelor of science in pharmacy and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Cherry is borrowing PHP 7,870 to pay tuition fees for her daughter, Maria Camille, for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Maria Camille plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Mantitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANTITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de huevo, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de comida y venta de chamarras y venta de coca.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de huevo; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de huevo por mayor) que las adquirirá de las poblaciones y de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “MANTITAS” communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Regional Center. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Teresa is Secretary. The businesses in which the members are engaged are varied and include selling: eggs, clothing, fruit, sweets, soft drinks, food, jackets, and coca. The loan they are taking out will benefit micro entrepreneurs where Teresa is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of one of the institution's advisors.

Teresa currently has a business selling eggs. She states that she learned this business a few years ago at her own initiative. The loan is to increase capital to buy eggs at wholesale which she will buy from the people and at the fairs in the city of El Alto. She will then resell them at the fairs in El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy eggs at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spray pumps and sprayers for spraying his crops to protect them from being attacked by insects that would lower their quality.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. She has worked hard as a hairdresser for 10 years to support her husband who retired from being a soldier. Fatima covers her family's living necessities, especially those of her three children who are enrolled in private schools.
Fatima puts forth so much effort to develop her working talents and skills so she can develop her business in a special way to attract more customers and increase her income.
