For this reason, Fatima decided to acquire a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise and make necessary repairs to her salon. She will also use the loan to pay for special vocational training sessions that will improve her skills.
Fatima is working hard to move her beauty salon to a larger space where she can provide several additional beauty services.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and make necessary repairs to her salon as well as to pay for special vocational training sessions that will improve her skills.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in the pig fattening business for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas,

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a cow shed for her livestock

loans.name: Jose Ylden

texts.es:
José Ylden tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, caña, comercio en general y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. José ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar una mayor cantidad de ganado y animales menores como cerdos y pavos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, esto le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Ylden is 53 years old and lives with his wife in the Oyotún district. The people of this district make a living growing rice, sugar cane, working in general businesses and farming. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the northern coast of Perú. He is a farmer, has experience in this business and has good personal and work references in the district. 

José is requesting this loan to buy more cattle and small animals such as pigs and turkeys, to fatten them up and then sell them at a better price.  This will generate more income which will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and small animals, such as pigs and turkeys to fatten them and sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha works hard to support her family. Juditha is married and has a buy-and-sell beauty products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Juditha successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

In the future, Juditha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 42 years old and married with two children.  With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Basen village with his wife and two sons, ages 7 and 6 years old. 
Armen's main occupation is cattle breeding. He currently owns livestock: 20 sheep, two cows, five calves and 30 hens near the house in the family's yard, Armen also does cultivation of wheat. 
From the cows he currently has, Armen sells around 10 liters of raw milk/day for most of the year. 
Besides selling dairy products, Armen also gets income from raising and selling sheep and calves. He works hard to get income and sustain his family's standard of living. 
Because the region where Armen'a village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Armen's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes (hoes/mattocks) for cultivating and preparing for planting.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANANTIAL DE VIDA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CD´s, venta de pan, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, servicio de taxi y venta de artesanías en piedra. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizeth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanías en piedra; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá inicio hace ocho años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artesanías en piedra por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de Desaguadero y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MANANTIAL DE VIDA”  communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Center. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Lizeth is President. The businesses in which the members of the communal bank are engaged are varied and include: sale of CDs; sale of bread, sale of meals; neighborhood store; taxi service; and sale of stone handicrafts. 

The loan they will take out will benefit micro entrepreneurs where Lizeth is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of her mother who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling stone handicrafts and states that she learned this business from her mother and started it eight years ago. 

This loan will be used to increase her capital so she can buy stone handicrafts at wholesale. She will buy them from wholesalers in the city of Desaguadero and then resell them from her selling space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the health clinic and the training the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy stone handicrafts.

loans.name: Ednar

texts.en:
Ednar is 42 years old from the Kobuleti district, where he lives with his wife and 2 children.

Ednar has worked at a local taxi company as a driver for many years and gets a monthly income. He decided to start his own business and requested a loan for purchasing a car. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 950 USD. With the received credit and the money he has already saved, Ednar will purchase a car. He will be able to serve people as a taxi driver with his own car. He will be able to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Ednar awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 42 years. and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Aguilas De Corazón Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUILAS DE CORAZÓN” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wara es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de puertas, venta de comida, venta de celulares, venta de muebles, venta de jugos de fruta, venta de cosméticos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wara es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace tres años de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la fabricación, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos otorgados y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AGUILAS DE CORAZÓN” coomunal bank has started their 14th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional branch. It is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors with Wara as the President. The businesses that the communal bank members run are varied. Amongst them are: selling doors, selling food, cellphone sales, furniture sales, selling fruit juice and the sales of cosmetics.

The loan they are taking out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, Wara being one of them. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling furniture. She says that she learned this business three years ago from her parents.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying wood wholesale) that she will buy at the stalls in the city of El Alto and later fabricate and sell in her sales space. This method of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is single. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the loans and the health services provided by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
With the goal of having her own lumber shop someday, Alicia is exerting her best efforts to improve her business. She buys big lumber then cuts it into different sizes or strips and sells it at retail. She also ventures into hog raising at the same time.

Alicia is from Tigbauan, Iloilo, one of the areas devastated by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Rehabilitation and construction of houses and other structures is ongoing in the area, and demand for lumber continues to increase. Alicia wants to grab this opportunity to enhance her income, that’s why she’s requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use this to buy additional lumber and also to finance her hog raising business. She is positive that she won’t have any problem in paying it back because she already has contacted buyers.

She is married to Benito, a farmer, and they have children whom they love very much. Alicia believes that education is very important. She and her husband really strive to reach their dream of having professional children someday. She also gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and jembes, or digging hoes, for cultivating and preparing his fields for planting.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Amalia is in the aquaculture business, farming oyster in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her oyster farm.

Amalia has been farming oysters for 17 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her oyster farm.

loans.name: San Cristobal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN CRISTOBAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, venta de salchipapa, venta de cuadernos, venta de helados, venta de zapatillas y venta de chalecos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá inicio hace un año.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y salchicha por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The San Cristobal communal bank is going to begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a Board of Directors, of which Maribel is the President.  The group members carry out various businesses, among them: transportation services, salchipapa [hot dog and potato] sales, notebook sales, ice cream sales, sneaker sales, and vest sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small-time entrepreneurs; Maribel is one of these.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is part of the institution.  She currently has a business selling salchipapa.  She shares that she learned this business from her mother and started it a year ago.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her capital (for the purchase of potatoes and hotdogs in bulk).  She will get these from the wholesale merchants in the city of El Alto and later, having prepared them, she will sell them from her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is single and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and hot dogs in bulk

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 57-year-old widow with two children. Three years ago she opened a grocery shop with a roastery section to cover her family's needs, for she is their only breadwinner. She is a hard and ambitious worker and a sacrificing mother who is trying to develop her business.

Manal started working decorating chocolates. Through the years she developed her business into a grocery shop with a roastery section. (A Lebanese roastery offers roasted nuts and confections.) She now has loyal customers and a good reputation in her neighborhood.

Manal is applying for a 1,300 USD loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to add new merchandise and products for the upcoming holy month of Ramadan. She hopes to develop her business to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to add new merchandise and products for the upcoming holy month of Ramadan.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 35 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself.

Julie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Julie Ann has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Julie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes (digging hoe) for cultivating and preparing for planting so as to meet family needs.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma.Linda is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her general store. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from her general store she is also a dealer of popular direct-selling products. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, and undergarments to meet the increased demand for her products, especially now that school year has started in the Philippines. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Linda dreams that her business will continue to flourish to afford her to give her children a college education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for clothing, footwear, and undergarments needed in her direct selling business.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 51 years old and married with seven children. 

Precila is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Precila has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Precila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns her own house, but it has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past three years Kupha has managed a shop where she sells consumables such as wheat and maize flours and sugar. She also sells poultry. Transportation is a major challenge for her.

Kupha decided to join Yehu to access its loans to develop her business. She is applying for a 25,000 KES through Kiva's field partner Yehu to buy more sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 55 years old, is married and supports four children. She is a small-scale farmer earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops for more harvest. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve her family's living standard. 

Her hope is to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops for more harvest

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 52 years old and has nine children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rowena has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Glory is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Glory has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glory would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes for cultivating and preparing for planting

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 42 years old and all of her children are attend in school.

Rebecca has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is 63, a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
 
Ceferina has a processed food business in the Philippines. Ceferina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ceferina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ceferina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Girly

texts.en:
Girly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Girly has been in this business for 5 years. Girly earns more income from raising chickens.

Girly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jenelle

texts.en:
Jenelle is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelle is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jenelle has been in this business for 1 year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Alicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Alicia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort, 50, is single with four children, two of whom attend senior high school. She has an organic, fair-trade-certified oil palm farm and lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. 

Comfort believes organic oil palm farming is profitable and helps protect the environment. She wants to secure a microloan to expand her organic oil palm field. Doing so will enable her to earn extra income, which will support her children’s education and enable her family to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 71, is married with 12 children. Five of his children have completed senior high school; the remaining seven still attend school. He has an organic, fair-trade-certified oil palm farm and also works as an assembly man in Pramkese, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana's Eastern Region. 

Daniel believes organic oil palm farming is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. He wishes to secure a microloan to expand his oil palm field. 

The additional income he earns from selling organic oil palm fruits will enable him to fund his children's education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Али   в  возрасте 41 лет проживающий в сельской местности. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. На базаре Али  имеет магазин, где продает мужскую  одежду,   который он открыла своими силами, чтобы хоть как то помочь и обеспечивать семью. Постепенно он  смог расширить свой товарооборот и увеличить прибыль. Сейчас прибыль с магазина является основным источником дохода для его  семьи. Недавно Али  сделал  ремонт в доме,  это увеличило его расходы. На данный момент  у Али финансовые проблемы и у него не хватает денег,  чтобы закупить товар для магазина. С этой проблемой он  решил  обратиться в «АРВАНД» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Али  хочет увеличить свой товарооборот.
texts.en: Ali is 41 years old age and lives in a rural location. He is married and has two children. Ali has a store at the market where he sells men's clothing. He opened it on his own in order to somehow help and provide for his family. He was able to expand his stock gradually and increase his profits. Now the profit from the store is the main source of income for his family. Recently Ali renovated his house, which increased his expenses. At the moment Ali has financial problems and he does not have enough money to buy goods for the store. With this problem he decided to turn to Arvand for support. With the money he will receive, Ali wants to increase his stock.

loans.use: to increase his store's stock of men's clothing.

loans.name: Apóstol Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Apóstol Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Liz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de joyas, venta de dulces, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de artículos en metal, venta de ropa y tienda de barrio.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Liz es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, aceite y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el ahorro y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “APOSTOL SANTIAGO” communal bank group will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Apóstol Santiago II. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Liz is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied and include food sales, jewelry sales, candy sales, clothing sales, the sale of metal items, clothing sales, and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business-owners of whom Liz is one. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining due to a massive promotion done by the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business from her mother some years ago. 

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase noodles, oil and rice in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later, after preparations, she will sell in her food stand in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is single and has one child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, oil and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Al Mareg 50548 Group

texts.en:
Youmna is the featured borrower for Al Mareg 50548 Group. She agreed with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.
Youmna is a 53-year-old married mother of three children who started twelve years ago knitting to help her husband meet the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious lady who has a professional skills in this domain. She well known among her region for her beautiful work and she is trying desperately to develop her business. She is also a sacrificing mother who is working hard to improve her family's living conditions. Today, Youmna is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary knitting tools and materials to create new fashionable items for sale and she also wants to renovate her house to make it a better place for her family. Youmna is the first lady on the left of the photo.
With respect to the other group members, May is the lady standing in the middle, and Huda is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary knitting tools and materials and  to renovate her house

loans.name: Santiago Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de libros, venta de ropa, servicio de taller soldador, venta de comida, venta de condimentos, venta de joyas y tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de libros; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga hace más de cinco años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra libros para niños por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “SANTIAGO II” communal bank group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers of whom María is the president. The businesses that the communal bank group members have are varied, and include book sales, clothing sales, a welding shop, food sales, seasoning sales, jewelry sales and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business-owners of whom María is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling books. She says that she learned this business from her friend more than five years ago.

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase children's books in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will later sell in the fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase children's books in bulk.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 48 year old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and mother of three children.  She has been working from home in tailoring since 2006, to help her family to meet the needs of life and providing support for her husband. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. 

With the aim to improve her job, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new materials for her business such as textiles, scissors and many other items. This will helped her to offer a greater variety of products and, therefore, improve her income

loans.use: to buy new materials for her tailoring business, such as textiles, scissors and many other items

loans.name: Consepitha

texts.en:
Consepitha is 59 years old, is married and supports 8 children. 

She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds to improve milk production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds to improve milk production

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 38 years old and has five children. Fanny is married and has four children are currently in school.

Fanny is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Fanny requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Fanny has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Rexey Max is 17 years old and is 3rd of the three children in the family. Her mother Martina a member of NWTF, supports the family through her raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Rexey Max is studying bachelor of science in nursing and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course.

Martina is borrowing PHP 4670 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Rexey Max for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Rexey Max plans to have a stable job so she could help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay her 2nd year advanced education tuition fees in nursing

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en:
Ma. Gemma is 33 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, shampoo, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 54 years old and married with eight children.  With one child in school, Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fortaleza 5K Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de focos, venta de enaguas, venta de artículos en metal, venta de ropa y tienda de barrio.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la confección de prendas, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación que ofrece la institución y compartir con su banca comunal.
texts.en:
The “FORTALEZA” communal bank is starting their 6th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office, It is made up of nine members led by a board of directors with Rosa as the President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. Amongst them are: selling sweets, the sales of clothing, selling light bulbs, selling petticoats, selling metal items, clothing sales and a neighborhood store.

The loan they are taking out will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs, Rosa amongst them. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago during a massive promotion by the institution. She currently has a business sewing and selling clothing. She says that she learned this business from a friend several years ago.

The loan she is now taking out is to increase her capital (buying fabric and thread wholesale) which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later after making them into clothing, sell them in the markets of the city of El Alto. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is single and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers and shares with the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread wholesale.

loans.name: Thuon

texts.en:
Thuon, 59 years old, is a widowed rice farmer who lives with her two grownup children, a son and a daughter, in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1980. Her son is 29 years old and works as a construction worker. Her daughter is a 22-year-old factory worker. Together, they can earn around $15 per day. 

Her son is getting married soon but Thuon does not have enough money to cover her son's wedding expenses, so she would like a loan. This loan will help her have enough money to hold a traditional wedding for her son. In the future, she is going to save up for the house renovation.

loans.use: to cover her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Amanecer Andino Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER ANDINO” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leslie es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de fresco hervido, venta de jugo de frutas y venta de joyas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leslie es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer hace siete años, por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chompa y camisa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de la La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “AMANECER ANDINO” communal bank group will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Leslie is president. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied and among them are clothing sales, quinoa drink sales, food sales, blanket sales, sales of freshly boiled food, fruit juice sales, and jewelry sales. 
	
The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business-owners of whom Leslie is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of a friend who is part of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothing, and says that she learned this business from a friend a number of years ago. 

The loan that she is now getting is to increase her capital (purchase sweaters and shirts in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family; she is single. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for topdressing her crops

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito is a farmer living at Padul. He is 42 years old, married and has three children. In his rice field, he plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. He had been in his business for over 10 years. He wanted to continue operating his farming business by ensuring good crop production that is why he is now asking for a loan of P18,000 to buy rice seeds and liters of fertilizers and pesticides. This will help nourish crops to produce good harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and liters of fertilizers and pesticides for a better crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease more land to expand his nappier grass farming activity.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose 29 years old, is married and supports 2 children. 

She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES13,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to put up a cow shed for her livestock. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to put up a cow shed for her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for her farming activity

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 32 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalina has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a married man with four children living in Hoima, Uganda. His major business is produce buying and selling, supplemented by the monthly salary from his teaching services. He ventured into income on realizing that what he was earning from teaching was not enough to sustain his family. 

Deo's business dream is expanding his produce business by buying enough stock to supply to his customers and increase returns. He meets a challenge of inadequate capital to buy enough stock. He is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Rochele

texts.en:
Rochele works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rochele requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Rochele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Elegita

texts.en:
Ma.Elegita is 54 years old, married and has one child. 

Ma.Elegita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma.Elegita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma.Elegita has been farming vegetables for twenty years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma.Elegita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Concesa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming seaweed. Concesa is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Concesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Maria has been in this business for five years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Christine sells retail household goods, a business she has done for the last 21 years, and it has been profitable. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will be using to buy additional retail goods like cooking fat, flour and soft drinks to sell to her customers. 

She hopes this will help her to clear school fees for her children in university.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional retail goods like cooking fat, flour and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a cow shed for her livestock

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 44 years old. She is married and blessed with six children. 

She has had a clothes business for 12 years and it has been profitable. 

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya; she will be using the loan to purchase more stock of new clothes for her shop. This will enable her to educate her children through university.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and provide well for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new clothes for her shop

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 38 years old. He is married and blessed with six children.

He has had an onion supply business for 12 years. He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to add more stock of onions to supply to his customers. 

He hopes this will enable him to pay school fees for his children and complete his new house. 

His hope and dream for the future is to buy a pickup to use in transporting his onions to customers up country.

His hopes and dreams for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to add more stock of onions to supply to his customers

loans.name: Clemensia

texts.en:
Clemensia 62 years old, is married and supports 4 children. 

She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 15,000 Per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to put up a cow shed. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to put up a cow shed

loans.name: Lucila Santos

texts.es:
Lucila, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada  y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 4 hijos pero todos están acompañados y nadie vive con ellos. 

Lucila, tiene un molino por más de 30 años y fue herencia de sus padres, además tiene una venta de pupusas, antes tenía una tienda, pero la ha quitado por la delincuencia, los negocios lo tiene en su casa y los horarios de atención es en la mañana desde muy temprano hasta la 1:00 p.m. y la venta de pupusas en la tarde. 

El préstamo lo necesita para alquilar las tierras donde su esposo sembrara maíz y para darle mantenimiento al molino, pues una tolva les está fallando, anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito y manifestó que fue de gran ayuda. 

El sueño de Lucila, es que su negocio siga creciendo y tener más clientes para poder ganar un poquito más de dinero.
texts.en:
Lucila, 51 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. She is partnered and her spouse is a farmer. They have 4 children, but they are all partnered and none live with them.

Lucila has had a mill for over 30 years and it was the legacy of her parents. In addition, she sells pupusas. Before, she had a store, but it was taken from her due to crime. She has the businesses in her house and they are open from early morning to 1:00 pm and she sells pupusas in the afternoon.

She needs the loan to rent the land where her husband will plant corn and to do maintenance on the mill, since the hopper is broken.  Previously, she got a loan and says that it was a big help. 

Lucila's dream is that her business continues to grow, and to have more customers to be able to earn a bit more money.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land where her husband will plant corn and to do maintenance on her mill.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged 35 and happily married with one wife and four children aged 15, 12, 10 and 7. His four children are all in school.

Robert is borrowing a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDL). He is principally a farmer of coffee, tea and has a banana plantation. He works for 7 hours a day and 6 days a week, and he also has a side income of a salary. He started the business in order to generate income for his family household.

The loan purpose is to buy fertilizers, chemicals and mulches for his plantations. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. Robert started business in 2010. He hopes to own large plantations of coffee and bananas and produce more for sale. He is always faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt and high prices for agricultural inputs.  He is a hard working person.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the repair to a lathe machine and to buy various tools for her husband's machine shop.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es madre de 5 hijos que aun están bajo su cargo, Concepción de dedica a la producción de café bajo distintos sellos de certificación, actualmente quiere certificar su finca bajo la norma orgánica y aprovechando que las plagas han casi terminado con sus cafetales ah decidido replantar  su parcela para iniciar la certificación con la plantación nueva. Ella lucha a diario por sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella sueña con darles la mejor educación posible para que tengan las oportunidades que ella no ah tenido.
La certificación de los cafetales es algo nuevo en la región y toda una novedad ya que permite conseguir mejores mercados para el café, Concepción quiere replantar 1.75 hectáreas con café bajo la certificación orgánica.
Concepción solicita un crédito para inicia la replantación y certificación de su finca con las ganancias de su café ella piensa mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y cubrir algunos gastos de la educación de sus hijos.
Un crédito ayudara a Concepción a tener mejores ganancias por la venta de su café además de brindarle la oportunidad de  dar una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Concepción is the mother of 5 children who are in her care. Concepción works growing coffee under various seals of certification. Currently she wants to certify her farm as organic and to make the most of the pests that have almost destroyed her coffee plans, she has decided to replant her land to begin certification with the new plantation. She fights daily to get her children ahead. She dreams of giving them the best education possible so that they have opportunities she has not had. 

Certification of the coffee plantations is something new in the region and quite novel since it allows getting better markets for the coffee. Concepción wants to replant 1.75 hectares with coffee under organic certification. 

Concepción asks for a loan to begin the replanting and certification of her farm. With the earnings from the coffee, she plans to improve her family's quality of life and pay some of her children's educational expenses. 

A loan will help Concepción to get more income for her coffee sales, in addition to offering her the opportunity to provide a better education and quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants, organic fertilizer, and pay labor costs to convert her coffee plantation to organic production.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su pareja es comerciante en pequeño, tiene dos hijos que vive con ellos. 

Luis, vende tamales desde hace 7 años, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su venta, porque ahora todos los viernes hacen casi 800 tamales por pedidos, ya que está asociado con una  Funeraria y en además es pastor de una Iglesia Evangélica.  

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta usada, con el objetivo de ahorrar combustible ya que en carro gasta mucho y otra parte del dinero la invertirá en el negocio de tamales.   
 
Uno de sus sueños es que su hija sea profesional y también que desea mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is 43 years old. He went to school until 6th grade. He is married and his partner is a small-time business woman. He has two children who live at home.     

Luis has been selling tamale (a traditional Mesoamerican dish) for 7 years. Little by little he has been increasing his number of sales and now he makes almost 800 tamales every Friday. He has ties to a funeral home and is also a pastor at an evangelical church.  

He needs the loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle. This will enable him to save fuel as his truck uses a lot of fuel. Money which is not spent on the motorcycle will be invested into his business of making and selling tamale. 
 
One of his dreams is that his daughter becomes a professional. He also wants to keep his business going.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980 and is now living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. She knows IMON well and is thankful for their supportive services. She participated in training which was provided by IMON to its clients. Each time she visits IMON to get some suggestions and advice for her business. 

She has a business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products on her land. Her gained harvest she sells in nearby stores and domestic markets. She appealed to Kiva and IMON to get a loan to buy fertilizer, natural chemical and seeds. She hopes to be supported and awaits an improved harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and seeds for her agriculture business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Margarita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a married woman with 4 children. Khetam is very skilled in the art of hand crafts and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. She is making ceramic pots, frames and decorative supplies.
 
She has requested for a loan, and this loan will enable her to purchase more beads, supplies, frames, and tools to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Khetam closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more beads, supplies, frames and tools to meet orders from her customers on time, to earn good amount of profits

loans.name: Avazjon

texts.ru: Авазчон мужчина 30 лет, женат, отец двоих детей. Он закончил школу и начал работать на стройке, чтобы помогать родителям. В 20 лет он женился и обзавелся семьей. Он занимается животноводством. У него 10 баранов и 5 коров. Его жена доит коров и приготавливает очень вкусное молоко. Сам он занимается купле-продажей скота. В ночное время он работает таксистом. Чтобы обеспечить свою семью и дать своим детям будущее, он работает не покладая рук. В настоящее время он планирует расширить свой бизнес, купить скот. Но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Авазчон благодарит за доверие и помощь в трудные для него времена.
texts.en: Avazjon is a 30-year-old man. He is married and the father of two children. He graduated from school and began working on a construction site in order to help his parents. He got married and started a family at 20 years of age. He rears animals. He has ten sheep and five cows. His wife milks the cows and prepares very tasty milk. He himself buys and sells livestock. At night-time he works as a taxi driver. He works without rest in order to provide for his family and give his children a future. At the moment he is planning to expand his business and to buy livestock, but he has insufficient money. For this reason he has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Avazjon is grateful for the trust and support during difficult times.

loans.use: to buy some sheep.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac, 28 years old, is married to Norah and supports 2 children. 

He has been in the quarrying business earning an income of KES 8,000 Per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add laborers to assist him in his quarrying business. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. 

His hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to add laborers to assist him in his quarrying business

loans.name: Ace

texts.en:
This is Ace and he resides at Pasay City, Philippines together with his children and wife, Myrna. He is 30 years old and is currently busy in his buy and sell business. He often sells items like bags of different designs and usage. Through this, he's been able to sustain his family. 

He's unstoppable to reach his dreams. He has always wanted to have their own house and add more space in his stall. Given this fact, he's becoming more and more persistent each and every day. This is why, his family admires him for being a good father. 

Though he wants to improve his business to earn enough money, he can't, primarily because of financial insufficiency. With this, he's asking for help. He would like to take a loan of PHP 30,000, which he will basically use for maintaining his business and for buying additional merchandise products for his inventory. 

Now is your time to help! He will be fully overjoyed if you grant his request.

loans.use: to be used for maintaining his bag business and to buy additional merchandise for his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy precious gemstones for her husband's shop

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Meet Federico. Today, he is solely operating a toy store business. He is 47 years old and manages to work hard and even harder for his wife, Imelda and their three children. For them, he does everything he can to suffice their needs. 

Being a loving father, he wants someday to become a successful businessman so that he can earn enough for his kids' education. He hopes for a better future for them, that's why he wants them to finish their studies. And he's starting today with a hope to develop his business. 
 
For this reason, he would like to request a loan from you. He wants to ask for a PHP 10,000 loan that he would use to purchase more quantities and varieties of toy products to sell. With this, he'll be able to gain income, which is a big help to his family. 

He knows that he did chose the right people to help him with this. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities and varieties of toy products to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 49 years old, married with three children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Estela has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 13 years and also earns an income from frozen food.

Estela aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат женщина в возрасте 51 года проживающая в сельской местности. Латофат вдова и имеет 1 сына, которого воспитывает одна. Она занимается бизнесом на протяжении вот уже 22 лет. В начале она занималась торговлей продуктов питания. Постепенно увеличив товарооборот,  она стала заниматься торговлей детской и женской одежды.  Накопив достаточно денег она приобрела магазин на местном рынке. На данный момент она решила расширить свой бизнес так, как взяла в аренду еще один магазин. Тех денег,  что у нее есть не достаточно для покупки товара в новый магазин и с этой проблемой она решила обратиться в «АРВАНД»  за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги она хочет закупить товар для своего нового магазина.
texts.en: Latofat is a 51-year-old woman who lives in a rural location. Latofat is a widow and has a son whom she is raising alone. She has been in business for 22 years. At the beginning she used to sell groceries. Having gradually increased her stock, she began trading children's and women's clothing. Having saved up enough money, she acquired a store at the local market. Now she has decided to expand her business since she has rented another store. The money that she has is insufficient to buy goods for the new store and so she has decided to turn to Arvand for financial support with this problem. She wants to buy goods for her new store with the money she receives.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her store.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 57 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ofelia has a bakery business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Ofelia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 57 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelita is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angelita has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Making clothes is like shaping your life. Before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo cuts from its edges and a lot of pierces with the needle. 

In spite those, Marlyn still carries the spirit. She is now 64 and for her kids, there is nothing that she won't do. Now, she is involved in a tailoring business at their community in Pasay City, Philippines. This inventory has already helped her a lot in maintaining her household. 

She is really dreaming that this business will expand and grow in progress. To start reaching this dream, she needs your help. She would like to take a loan worth PHP 20,000 that she would utilize in buying additional supplies of materials she needs to make more clothes with needles, fabrics, and threads. Part of the amount will be used also for buying another sewing machine. 

Today, she is diligent enough and hardworking in her trade. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in buying additional supplies of materials she needs to make more clothes, like needles, fabrics, and threads and to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Clarita has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber for her business.

Clarita has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber for her business

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Suzette is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Suzette has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Suzette requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Suzette has been in this business for two years. In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Flor works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Flor is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care and other groceries for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catherine is 48 years old and has three children are still in school.

Catherine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Catherine has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Abduboqi

texts.ru: Абдубоки добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй  Абдубоки живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание  Абдубоки занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 20 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Также он работает электриком, как дополнительный доход. Его жена также работает преподавателем в своем кишлаке. Но сейчас  Абдубоки хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и обработать земли. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений и обработать земли.  Абдубоки очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abduboqi is a kind-hearted and hard-working 43-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Abduboqi lives with his family in a rural village. Abduboqi has his own business in order to earn a living. He has been growing crops for the last 20 years. Then, when he gathers the harvest, he takes it to a large market and sells it there. He previously used to work on a farm and then decided to sell his own crops. He also works as an electrician to get additional income. His wife works as a teacher in their village. But now Abduboqi wants to expand the crop-growing side of business. But at present he does not have enough of his own funds to buy mineral fertilizer and treat his land. As a result he has turned to Arvand and wants to take a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and treat his land. Abduboqi very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to treat his land.

loans.name: Ghadir

texts.en:
Ghadir is a 21 year old single Lebanese woman who lives with her parents. Her father is their main income provider and fulfills their needs. To help him, Ghadir started her own home business as a private teacher in 2013 and looks to further improve her work. .

Today, she would like to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a laptop in order to develop her teaching abilities and gain added students. In the future she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her private teaching project

loans.name: Ángela Patricia

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, no tiene hijos. El cónyuge es chofer profesional.
Doña Ángela es una muy  buena esposa que trata de ayudar a su esposo con la dura carga del hogar, ella realiza los créditos, para que él  utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taxi en el cual transporta al público en general,  el sale en las mañanas a las 06h30 y regresa a la 13h00  que es la primera jornada y la segunda de 14h00 a 19h00. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado  pero le gusta conducir ya que es chofer profesional.
Este crédito es para pagar el mantenimiento del taxi. Lleva dos ciclos Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, popular, and visited seaside vacation spot in Ecuador due to its beautiful and inviting beaches.  It is one of the most important deep-water ports in Ecuador and South America.

In this place lives Angela.  She is 27 and has a common-law marriage.  She has no children.  Her husband is a professional driver.  

Angela is a very good wife, who tries to help her husband with the difficult tasks of the home.  She makes the loans so he can use it in his work.  He has a taxi in which he transports the general public.  He leaves each morning at 6:30 and returns at 1:00 p.m., which is the first work cycle, and the second is from 2:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.  His work is very demanding, but he likes to drive, since he is a professional driver.

The loan is to pay for maintenance of the taxi.  This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because of the help it has given her with the loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a cow shed and lease land for nappier grass for her livestock

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Making clothes is like shaping your life. Before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo cuts from its edges and a lot of pierces with the needle. 

In spite those, Leonida still carries the spirit. She is now 47 years of age and for her two kids, there is nothing that she won't do. As of now, she is involved in a tailoring business at their community in Pasay City, Philippines. This inventory had already helped her a lot in maintaining her household. 

She is really dreaming that this business will expand and grow in progress. To start reaching this dream, she needs your help. She would like to take a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she would utilize in buying additional supplies of materials she needs to make more clothes with the needles, fabrics, and threads. Part of the amount will be used also for buying another sewing machine. 

Today, she is diligent enough and hardworking in her trade. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: buying additional supplies of materials she needs to make more clothes with the needles, fabrics, and threads and for buying another sewing machine.

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.ru:
Анзурат женщина 50 лет, вдова, мать двоих детей. Она не получила высшего образования, так как не было средств для оплаты университета. После окончания школы её выдали замуж. Вот уже на протяжение 20 лет Анзурат занимается животноводством. В её стаде 15 баранов и 3 коровы. Баранов она откармливает и продает, взамен им покупает молодых и так же откармливает до определенного веса. К тому же Анзурат занимается приготовлением молока.
Муж Анзурат умер 6 лет назад. Она живет со своим старшим сыном и его семьей. У него четверо детей. Они живут в одной комнате все вместе. Им приходится очень тесно. Поэтому Анзурат решила начать стройку и построить себе отдельную комнату на старости лет. Комната почти готова, но осталось посадить окна и пол. Анзурат уже в пожилом возрасте и может заболеть от холода или жары. Поэтому она решила посадить пластиковые окна и горячий пол. Но в данный момент у нее нет полной суммы денег.
