Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Анзурат благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Anzurat is a 50-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of two children. She did not get a higher education as there was not enough money to pay for university. She got married after graduating from school. Anzurat has been rearing animals for the past 20 years. She has fifteen sheep and three cows in her herd. She fattens and sells the sheep, buys young ones in their place and then fattens them up in the same way up to a certain weight. Anzurat also prepares milk.

Anzurat's husband died six years ago. She lives with her eldest son and his family. He has four children. They all live together in one room. They have to be very close. For this reason Anzurat has decided to start construction and build a separate room for herself for her old age. The room is almost ready, but the windows and floor remain to be installed. Anzurat is already elderly and can fall sick from the cold or the heat, so she has decided to install vinyl windows and a heated floor. But at present she has insufficient money. She has therefore applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Anzurat is grateful for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy vinyl windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes for cultivating and preparing for planting so as to meet family needs.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is so grateful that she was granted a Php 50000 PHP loan which she used to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments needed in her food stall business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for another Php 50000 which she will use to buy ingredients such as fresh chicken, pork, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed to cook meals which she serves at her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Lanie hopes to sustain and grow her food business. She prays to send her children to College to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes for cultivating and preparing for planting so as to meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and jembes (hand plough) for cultivating and preparing for planting

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish vending.

Rosalina dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina is 60 years old and married with two children. Darlina works very hard to provide for them.

Darlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Darlina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Darlina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo en Padecomsm por la facilidad de pago y para tener todo listo en la próxima siembra, invertirá en abono, semilla, fertilizantes e insecticidas para continuar trabajando en el cultivo de maíz.
Con el préstamo anterior se compró materiales para darle un buen desarrollo al cultivo teniendo como resultado una cosecha abundante y mejores ingresos, que ha utilizado para optimizar las condiciones de vida familiar y para cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan from PADECOMSM due to the ease of making payments and in order to have everything ready for the next planting.  We will invest in compost, seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to continue working in the cultivation of corn.

With the previous loan, he bought himself materials to help his crop develop well.  As a result, he had an abundant harvest and better income, which he has used to improve his family’s living conditions and to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to continue working in the cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married, and has two kids who both attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her  living standards.

loans.use: to  purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale

loans.name: Luul

texts.en:
Luul is 40 years old and lives in Hargeisa City, Somaliland. She is married and has six children who study at school. For the past three years, Luul has been working hard to manage her supermarket which sells clothes and electronics in Hargeisa. 

She requested $1500 to expand her supermarket and the loan will be used to buy more electronics, clothes and will help Luul to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. In the future, Luul wishes to open up another branch or to enlarge her existing supermarket.

loans.use: To buy clothes and electronics for her supermarket

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 8 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de papa.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘el Abra’ área rural, caracterizado por encontrarse el penal de máxima seguridad. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7-23 grados centígrados.
Primitiva es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no existe el alcantarillado. El agua del lugar proviene del rio o de pozo, recientemente llegó la conexión de agua potable la cual es accesible para algunos pobladores, “vivimos aqui casi todas nuestras vidas y el agua potable recien esta llegando, es prioridad realizar la instalacion por el bien de nuestras familias...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la demanda es constante y cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de agua potable para sus hijos que son menores de edad. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que su familia deje de beber agua sucia de rio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Primitiva solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería para que sus hijos dejen de beber agua contaminada de rio.
texts.en:
Primitiva, 47, is married and has two children, both boys, 12- and 8-years old, respectively.  She sells all kinds of potatoes. She is a good mother, entrepreneur, patient, good listener, supportive, responsible and hardworking. She operates her business in a rural area called El Abra that is known for a nearby prison.  This area has a mild climate throughout the year and the day-time temperatures vary from 7- to 23-degrees, Centigrade.
Primitiva is a dark-skinned woman with brown eyes and black hair, worn in long braids.  She is shorter-than-average height and strongly built.  She wears traditional dress (hat, sweater, overdress).  She speaks Quechua, her first language, at home and Spanish that she uses in her  business.  Primitiva's husband is a farmer and her children are in school.  They live in a small house with one bedroom in a land that they own. This house is made of concrete and bricks with a dirt floor.  
The house has electricity, but isn't plumbed for water and the family pumps the water they need from a well instead. There is no sewage system. Water service is now available in the area.  

“We live here most of our lives and clean water is recently available; it is a priority to connect to the water system for the benefit of our families …," she says. The advantage of her business is that her business demand is constant and has daily sales, and the disadvantage is the lack of clean water for her young children. Her dream is to have clean water in her home. she wants to connect clean water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room; so that, her family will stop drinking dirty water from the river. This is the first loan she is requesting to the institution in 10 years she is doing this activity.
It is for these reasons that Primitiva requests a loan for accessing clean water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room; so that, this will save her children from the dangers of drinking contaminated river water.

loans.use: to access clean water and save her children from the dangers of drinking contaminated river water.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary 31 years old, is married and supports 3 children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES15,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve production. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: To buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray her crops to improve production.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 34 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. She has been working at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life and living properly. She is very talented person working in this type of business since 2010. She produces different clothing designs and makes repairs as well. She is well-known in her region by the good products provided to her clients. 

To better develop her work, she is requesting a second from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. with the aim to buy a new sewing machine and new materials for her business such as textiles and other items in order to improve her income by a good percentage.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and new materials for her business such as textiles and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tents and bamboo for husband's catering services

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 31 years old married man from Gori district. He lives with his wife and school-aged son. Despite having a high education diploma, Giorgi is unemployed and he sometimes serves local people as a taxi driver to generate income. He decided to start a business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables Giorgi to get a loan of 700 USD. With the received credit Giorgi will start trade cheese and will have a stable income.

Giorgi is very motivated to have a stable income and improve the living conditions of his family. Giorgi awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade cheese in order to increase his family income

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза 32 летняя женщина района Руми. Она женщина, которая всегда думает о семье и не боится трудиться. Феруза занимается животноводством. Животноводческая деятельность очень интересная и привлекательная занятия. Она хорошо заботится о своих домашних животных, Феруза кормить их хорошо. Она одна выращивает крупнорогатого скота, потому что ее дети еще маленькие и муж находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. Муж тоже заботливый человек, он вдали от семье, чтобы зарабатывать и прокормить свою семью. Феруза хочет увеличить поголовье скота, потому что у нее осталось малое количества скота. Она за счет кредита решила купить скота, сохранить бизнес и не потерять источник дохода. Феруза надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Feruza is a 32-year-old woman residing in the Rumy region. She is constantly thinking about the family and is not afraid of hard work. Feruza breeds cattle for a living. This activity is very interesting and appealing to her. She takes good care of the animals and feeds them well. 

Feruza is raising cattle alone since her kids are too small and her husband is away in Russia working. He is very caring, too, and is forced to be away from home to earn enough money to provide for his family. Feruza wants to increase cattle headcount as she only has few head left. She is planning to use the borrowed money to purchase cattle to save the business and not lose her earnings. Feruza is hoping for your support!

loans.use: to increase cattle headcount and save the business

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn, who is 38, is a married woman and lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two children who live under her support. 

To make a living and support her family, Sokhoeurn manages and operates a farming business on a small farm which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this business for around twenty years. On average, she can generate earnings of USD 5.00 per day.

The current farmland that Sokhoeurn owns is small and it provides less benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area, but she cannot afford this. Therefore, she would like to take a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. 

Sokhoeurn is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Chavelas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAVELAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Albertina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, venta de CD´s, venta de pan, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, ventad de mantas y venta de ropa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Albertina es integrante, ella indica que hace varios años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de librería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de material escolar por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Chavelas” will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani.  It is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors, of which Albertina is the President.  The business that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, including a book store, CD sales, bread sales, food sales, a corner store, blanket sales, and clothing sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Albertina is a member.  She says that several years ago she joined Pro Mujer because of the invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  At present, she has a book store business, and she says that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago. 

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital and buy school materials at wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  Then, she will sell the materials in her sales space.  This form of working allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health area and the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy school materials at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and jembes for cultivating and preparing for planting so as to meet family needs.

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Yum, 56, lives in a community of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of seven children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jembes, maize seeds and fertilizer for planting so as to get a better harvest and meet family needs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as her major challenge. Lucia dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en:
Sinath, 41, lives in a community of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of rice farmland, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 29-year-old single man who started three years ago working in the municipality of his town to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man who is always working hard to increase his income and build his future life.

His limited salary encouraged him to start a new business as a second source of income. Thus, today Jalal is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start selling beans and corn on a cart in his town. This loan is very important to Jalal, for it will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling beans and corn on a cart in his town.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet their daily demands for milk supply

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Venic

texts.en:
Venic is 38 years old, married to Thomas and supports 3 children. 

She has been practicing farm supply on the open market for the last 5 years earning KES11,000 per month.

Venic has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stocks of farm produce for sale for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to high levels.

Her future hopes and plans are to be financially stable with a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of farm produce for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: in buying seed variety, fertilizer, insecticides and in paying labor in transplanting his rice farm land

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Dipu is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives at Alipurduar in West Bengal, India. She is a mother of two young daughters; they are studying in grade 5 and grade 1. Dipu is an enterprising woman. She engaged herself in a family-run sewing business and works together with her husband. They live in a kachha house, which is made with bamboo, tin, wood, and mud.

Dipu's husband purchases sewing material from a nearby town and Dipu stitches different men's and women's attire. Dipu's husband supplies the products to the local shops as well as to their neighbors. They strive hard to survive, as this business is the only source of income for the family.

Unfortunately, their tireless work brings very marginal income per month, which is barely enough for the household as well as to bear the educational cost of her daughters. They feel that they should increase their production, but they do not have sufficient capital to invest in their business. So, Dipu asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner). She will purchase one improved sewing machine, which will help her to sew more clothing with ease.

Dipu wishes to grow her business and save enough for the future for her daughters' education. She thanks her lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a new, improved sewing machine for her small-scale sewing business.

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en:
This young woman’s name is Vardush. She lives in Tsaghkunk Village in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and has a daughter. Vardush has a vocational education with a specialty in pedagogy. Although she never managed to find work in this field, it is useful for her as a woman because she can skillfully and correctly raise her child. 

In addition to caring for her child and household, Vardush takes care of her farm. Vardush both cultivates the land and raises animals.  The animals consist of a cow, a heifer, sheep and lamb. With the help of her husband, Vardush sells milk and mutton from the farm to customers. The vegetables grown include potatoes, garlic, greens, and peppers. The produce is sold at the city's wholesale market. 

Vardush is requesting a Kiva loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel, and fodder

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 40-year-old married woman who has four daughters and two sons. Her husband is a laborer. His monthly income is not enough cover the family's monthly expenses. Fatma bought a sewing machine and started sewing to increase her family's income. A 5,000 EGP loan helps her to buy more cloth to make clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply more milk to his clients thus increasing his income.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is 62 years old, married and supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been operating in her general retail for the last 16 years earning KES 19,000 per month. 

Mellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more general retail items for sale like crates of soda, botled juices and water for more income gain.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and build rental houses. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more general retail items for sale, like crates of soda, bottled juices and water for more income gain

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of  theft in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds for her small piggery

loans.name: Arnelia

texts.en:
Arnelia is a loving wife to her husband Elmor, a seaman, and a caring mother to their seven children. It’s not easy to raise seven children especially if her husband is away most of the time, but she can manage all the demanding tasks with the help of God. 

She owns a bakery and supplies bread in their community and nearby areas. This is the family’s source of additional income for eleven years. She has employed seven bakers and helpers. She considers her business as a good foundation that will expand in due time. The couple hopes to bestow a stable business to their children in the future. 

As of now, she needs additional capital of PhP 50,000 to buy raw materials for the bakery. In this way, she can expand her business little by little, so as to make it more stable and sustainable. Additional profit from this will be used for her children’s tuition and allowances in school. She dreams that someday her children will become successful professionals and entrepreneurs. She is knocking at your generous heart to help her with the needed capital. She won't have any problem in paying the loan because she has gained the virtue of a responsible entrepreneur. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her bakery

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 65 years old and a widow. She’s a strong woman considering the trials that she experienced in her life. She’s a survivor of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 together with her children. 

Corazon runs a “sari-sari” (variety) store in Oton, Iloilo and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. However, the income derived from her store varies from time to time, as it is usually affected by the competition within the area. Its stability is also shaken by some of her neighbors who have the habit of paying later for those items they get. Sometimes it takes few days or weeks before they pay. She is a kind-hearted person who cannot refuse her neighbors because she understands that there are times when it’s really hard to earn money. 

Because of this, she needs additional capital to make her business more stable. She plans to buy more stocks and she is requesting for PhP 50,000. With this additional capital, she would be able to boost her income and savings. She’s praying that you have the kind heart to extend support to her. It will surely go a long way.

Corazon dreams that all her children would be successful and have a better life in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her variety store

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Love for her children is the primary reason for Jona’s perseverance. Wanting to give them an abundant life in the future, she’s doing her best to enhance her variety store business and dried fish selling. She dreams that all her children will finish schooling because she knows that it’s the first step to their success.

Jona resides in Talisay City, Cebu with her husband Felix and their four children. She is operating a variety store that sells various commodities like canned goods, repacked cooking oil, sachets of shampoo and conditioner, packs of condiments and spices, charcoal, some vegetables, dried fish and many others. The profit from her business covers their family expenses and will help with her children’s education. She wants to gain more profit so she can better prepare for her children’s educational needs. 

To improve her business, she desires to ask for PhP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy more stocks of items to sell. In the long run, she hopes to put up another store to double her income.

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. Jona meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of variety store items

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Toka Village. Yusuf  joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and expand his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yusuf will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Yusuf now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all my children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields and help educate his children

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima Toka Vilage. Luka joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Luka will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Luka would like to use his extra earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Abira

texts.en: Abira is 36 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops to sell and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm. He hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and to enable him to have more farm produce sell.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en: Wilkister is 43 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. She is a farmer and has been growing cash crops. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm, in the hope this will enable her to get more farm produce to  sell and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati who is in her mid 30's is married with two children, who are still in school.  She has been selling soap for skin since 2007.  She works from 10am to mid-day (two hours)selling door to door and is able to make a  good monthly profit.

This will be Bahati's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to to increase on the soap stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is really happy with the loan and is doing great!  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a radio, a bed, mattresses, built her own house, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase on the shop stock and supply more customers.  She dreams of buying a plot and building another house.

Bahati will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase her shop stock and supply more customers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
“Puso” is the local term for hanging rice in Cebu, Philippines. It is boiled rice enclosed in woven coconut leaves which is usually displayed hanging along streets in Cebu. It is famous for travelers because they won’t need spoon and fork to eat this. They will just open the woven casing and they can bite the rice without mess. Others buy “puso” as packed meal to school, workplace or trips. Marcelina knows this need of travelers and commuters, hence she chose to venture in this kind of business. She combined it with softdrinks and other beverages. Her stall is located in the public market of Talisay City, Cebu.

Marcelina would like to buy additional sacks of rice and beverages that will surely enhance her profit. She is in need of PhP 50,000 supplemental capital for these. Hope you can be God’s instrument to help her so she can increase her profit, sustain their everyday needs, and boost her savings.

Marcelina is married to Ritchie, who is always supportive of her and her business. They know that they should preserve this kind of business because “puso” is a local product that represents their province. They intend to pass it on to the next generations.

Marcelina is praying for the success of her children who are already independent and raising their own families. She prays for peace and unity among their family members. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and cases of beverages for her business

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Toka Village. Musa joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Musa suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to have money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Musa has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 200 bags of maize this year, Musa can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35 years old and married. She has been operating a beauty parlor for many years. She offers her customers many services, including makeup, hairstyling, and facials. Due to her quality services, she has become famous on her street.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Shakeela is interested in buying a variety of new cosmetic products for her business. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy hair rollers, as well as hair care and skin care products for her salon. Her business profits will go towards building her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care and skin care products for her salon

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 37 years old and has two daughters and three sons. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Fatma has a lot of experience sewing. She wishes to help her husband and contribute to the family's income. Therefore, she is requesting a 1,000 EGP loan to buy a modern sewing machine to make clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Rehema who is in her mid 30s, is married with two kids who are still small.  She has been running a gengeduka for two years now.  She works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to  restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka business.  She dreams of opening a big business different from gengeduka.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group Imarika which consists of four members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka business.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: With her desire to help her husband even in a simple way, Sheryl put up a sari-sari store business. She is married and has one child. Sheryl sells variety of grocery items in their village. Most of the products she sells are canned goods, soft drinks, breads, and noodles. Sheryl wants to extend the products she is selling so that she may also earn higher income. With this, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy shampoo, soaps, biscuits, and powdered milk, juice, and coffee. Sheryl will invest some of her income to their farm's needs.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soaps, biscuits, and powdered milk, juice and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina, 40, lives in Talisay City, Cebu and is married to Juanito, a maintenance worker. They have three children, two of whom are in high school and one stays at home. In addition to paying the fees for her children in school, she works hard to support and maintain the household’s daily expenses.

Lorina operates a “sari-sari” store, a small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and the competition is stiff. Fortunately, she has a space for grilling chicken. She sells the grilled chicken by piece or chopped. It’s quite laborious for her, but she persists through the help of her family.

To help her continue the operation of her variety store and grill space, Lorina is applying for a PhP 30,000 loan which she will use to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sachets and packs of toiletries and many others. Part of it will be used for additional chicken to be grilled. This will make her business more stable and she will be able to increase her income. In due time, she plans to build an extension of her store soon or look for another place to put up another store.

She wants her children to get a college education to bring them better opportunities in life. She thanks God and you in advance for this financial assistance, for it will surely bring supplementary income for the family.

All CCT community clients such as Lorina are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her variety store and chicken for her grill business.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 59 years old, a widow with four children. 

Erlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlyn has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a Babban Gona farmer from Mai Yamma Talata Vilage. Ado joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ado will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. 

With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ado would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PODEROSAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa deportiva, venta de ganado ovino y porcino, venta de CDs, servicios de transporte, venta de muebles, ventad de chalecos y venta de salchipapa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa deportiva, da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años trabajando en una tienda.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra deportivos y poleras  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente comercializarlo en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The community association Las Poderosas will start their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Regional Center.  The group is made up of eight members and is led by an executive board with Maria as President.  The members have various businesses, including sports clothing sales, sheep and pig sales, CD sales, transportation services, furniture sales, vest sales, and salchipapa sales.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Maria.  She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of her mother, who is a client too.  Currently she has a business selling sports clothing.  She learned this business by working in a store for several years.  

She will use this loan to increase her capital and purchase sports shirts and t-shirts at wholesale.  She will purchase them from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then sell them at her sales space.  This work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health information and the trainings that are provided.

loans.use: to purchase sports shirts and t-shirts at wholesale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine 22 years old, is married and supports 2 children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES10,000 per month.She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops . She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: To purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops .

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah 33 years old, is married and supports 3 children. 

She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES15,000 Per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds to improve milk production. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family living standards. 

Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds to improve milk production

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas y pagar mozos para preparar el terreno que el que se dispondrá a sembrar granos básicos, espera recuperar la inversión con un margen mayor de ganancias.
Con el crédito anterior pudo realizar los trabajos agrícolas de temporada, está satisfecho por haber obtenido una cosecha considerable y de calidad, su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida y las condiciones financieras están mejorando.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to invest in farming supplies and to pay laborers to prepare his land so it is ready to plant basic grains.  He hopes to recover his investment with a larger profit margin.

His last loan allowed him to do his seasonal farm work.  He is satisfied that he had a considerable harvest of good quality.  His family has a better quality of life and his finances are improving.

loans.use: to invest in farming supplies and to pay laborers to prepare his land to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Roberto Belarmin

texts.es:
Roberto, es albañil, se dedica a desarrollar sus actividades a tiempo completo sin un horario establecido, trabaja de forma independiente desde aproximadamente cinco años, el oficio lo aprendió al apoyar a su padre, ya que él desempeñaba está actividad para abastecer su hogar con lo necesario para subsistir; tiene una familia formada por su esposa y un hijo de 5 años de edad, él es la única persona que trabaja.
Necesita comprar una pulidora, un cepillo eléctrico, palas, etc., para poder incrementar la calidad en sus obras de construcción, espera satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias para respaldar el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.
Su objetivo es administrar de buena manera el préstamo y cancelarlo con buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Roberto is a construction worker. He makes his living carrying out his work full-time, without an established schedule. He has worked independently for approximately five years. He learned the trade by helping his father, who worked in this area in order to provide the necessities to his home.

He has a family made up of his wife and a 5-year-old son. He is the only person who works.

He needs to buy a polishing machine, an electric brush, shovels, etc. in order to increase the quality of his construction projects. He hopes to fulfill his clients' requests and make more income in order to stand by his commitments.

His goal is to manage the loan well and to pay it back with a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine, an electric brush, shovels, etc. in order to increase the quality of his construction projects

loans.name: Jaba

texts.en:
Jaba is a hardworking entrepreneur from Alipurduar, West Bengal. She has only one son who is studying in college. Jaba is 43 years old and received a formal education up to 8th grade, due to her family's financial issues, but that could not curb her spirit. She runs a small business selling firewood to her villagers.  

Jaba's husband Gouttam is engaged in the shuttering business. Being seasonal, the business earns a very scant income. Jaba has been engaged in the firewood business for many years to supplement her family's income.  Her potential customers are her neighbors. She purchases logs from her village and neighboring villages, cuts them into small pieces and then resells them to her customers. She has chosen this business as firewood is used as a fuel for cooking in rural West Bengal. In this way, she earns money for her family, but it is not enough to provide the financial support the family needs.

Jaba decided to grow her business by selling more firewood. To that end, she asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase more logs to expand her business so that she will be able to earn a greater profit.  Jaba hopes this business will enable her to give financial sustenance to her family and better education to her only son.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase more stock of logs for her firewood business.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi, a 20-year-old woman, lives in a small village named Birpara in the Alipurduar district with her husband and one small daughter. She studied until 9th grade and after that she dropped out due to her family's poor economic resources. Madhabi’s husband runs a home-based modest grocery store with the help of Madhabi.

They sell the daily necessities consumed by the villagers like oil, biscuits, flour, rice, sugar, salt, etc. Madhabi manages the store in the absence of her husband. 

Madhabi wants to expand her business by stocking more grocery items in their grocery shop. This will attract more customers as well as elevate their business income. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying groceries in bulk will be difficult for them.  

Madhabi is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy grocery items for her shop.

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for this support.

loans.use: To purchase items for their grocery store.

loans.name: Samwuel

texts.en:
Samwuel is 33 years old, married to Olpha and supports a family of two children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last four years, earning KES 12,000 per month. 

Samwuel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a new motorcycle to earn more income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to open a retail shop in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to earn more income

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
This farmer’s name is Mher. He lives in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. Mher has to go to the Russian Federation seasonally to work abroad in order to earn more money for family needs. 

When he is not away, he spends time on his  farm and its development. On his farm Mher has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, piglets, sheep and chickens. With his wife's help, Mher sells his farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs. From his land he also sells potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, greens and peppers. He sells all of these products mainly to his regular customers. With this Kiva partnership, Mher hopes to develop swine breeding on his farm, so he will buy a pig and potato seedlings for his land cultivation work.

loans.use: to buy a pig and potato seedlings for his land cultivation work

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania es una joven dedicada a su trabajo como comerciante, tiene veinte y tres años de edad, ella decidió emprender un negocio de venta de sandalias y calzado, con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y el impulso de un primer préstamo por parte de Kiva y MiCrédito, logro a sacar adelante su negocio, ella está muy agradecida con ambas organizaciones. 
Para esta trabajadora mujer es indispensable la ayuda de Kiva junto MiCrédito, es por eso que ha solicitado nuevamente un financiamiento que le permita surtirse de lo que es su materia prima, y comprar nuevos estilos de zapatos y sandalias. Actualmente ella no cuenta con un local, por eso en un futuro planea tener su propio local donde pueda ofertar sus productos sin preocupación alguna.
texts.en:
Ivania is a young woman who is dedicated to her job as a saleswoman. She is 23 years old. She decided to start a business selling sandals and shoes. With the unconditional support of her husband and the boost of the first loan from Kiva and MiCrédito, she succeeded in getting her business off the ground. She is very thankful to both organizations.

The help of Kiva and MiCrédito are indispensable to this hard-working woman, so she has again requested a loan that will allow her to stock up on what is her raw materials -- new styles of shoes and sandals. Currently, she does not have a store, so in the future she plans to have her own store location where she can offer her products without any worry.

loans.use: to buy new styles of shoes and sandals

loans.name: Aroti

texts.en:
Aroti is from Dalimpur village in Falakata, West Bengal, India. She is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and two children: one son and one daughter.  Both are students and attend a village school.

Aroti's husband is a farmer.  Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of his livelihood and that he manages together with Aroti.  He grows different vegetables on his farm and sells his produce to the wholesale traders of the nearby market and also sells personally in his retail outlet. The income from this is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of the family as well as the farm expenses. To diversify the income and to earn better, they now like to grow paddy. Being a staple food, paddy ha very good acceptability in their local market. So Aroti wants to expand their business by taking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use it to buy paddy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for paddy cultivation. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Awurade Beye. It is composed of four women who wish to make a big impact in their respective businesses. They just started their second loan cycle after finishing the first cycle without issues. They all have been living in the same neighborhood for years and maintain good relations in the spirit of togetherness. They mainly work selling cloth, lining, stationery and keykey (cook corn paste). 

Florence, 41 years old, is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of two; one boy and one girl. She sells stationery in the market in Accra. She needs this loan to buy assorted books, pens, pencils, mathematics sets, envelopes, etc. and sell them to her customers. The group will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted books, pens, pencils, mathematics sets, envelopes, etc. and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
A 28-year-old young lady, Dipali, lives with her family in Dalimpur village in Falakata, West Bengal. Unfortunately, she only completed her education until grade 7 due to her family's financial issues. A mother of two children, Dipali is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer. One of her children goes to school; the other is a preschooler.

Her husband, Harakumar, cultivates different seasonal vegetables in his farmland. He sells the produce at the local market. Dipali is a hardworking mother who sells some vegetables door-to-door to earn a respectable income for her children’s quality education. Together, the couple earns a livelihood since this is their sole source of income. Despite their strenuous efforts, the income is barely enough for a family of four. To increase the revenue and consequently the profit from their agribusiness, Dipali has decided to cultivate paddy as it is a staple food of the region and the demand for it is also always good.

So Dipali seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to purchase farm supplies such as good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm resources. She hopes it will improve the viability of their businesses and can lead to a secure life in the future.

Dipali owes a debt of gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a shade for his business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 40 years old. She is a rural woman, hailing from the village of Parangerpar in Falakata, West Bengal, India. Anita is engaged in cattle farming. She lives with her husband and one son. Her two daughters are married and her only son reads in grade 7.

Her husband is engaged in agricultural activities from which he gets a low return.  So it make it very difficult for Anita to maintain her family. So she thought of an additional income source and started a milk-selling business with the help of her husband. Now she has a few cows that produce milk. Anita supplies this milk to the villagers on a daily basis. As there is growing demand for milk in her locality, Anita plans to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase another cow of an improved variety. Anita hopes the loan will help her to increase her milk production and thereby her income. 

She owes her gratitude to her generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase her dairy farming.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalía es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de lácteos, venta de mantas, venta de chuño, venta de ropa para bebé, ventad de cosméticos, venta de joyas y venta de alimentos enlatados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosalía es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer desde hace cuatro años, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra artículos de limpieza por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “SARTASIÑANI” is going to start its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro-Woman], as part of Centro Focal de Collpani [Focal Center of Collpani, Bolivia]. It is made up of 8 members and directed by an executive board of which Rosalía is president.

The businesses of the communal bank's members are varied. They include selling cleaning supplies, dairy products, blankets, freeze-dried potatoes, baby clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, and canned food.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs of whom Rosalía is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, invited by an advisor who is part of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling cleaning supplies. She mentions that she learned this business from her mom many years ago.

The loan that she is currently taking out is to increase capital (she buys cleaning supplies wholesale) that she will get from the wholesale vendors of the city El Alto. She will later sell them in her sales location. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the training that the institution offers

loans.use: to buy wholesale cleaning supplies

loans.name: Martha Aminta

texts.es:
Martha, utilizo el préstamo anterior para renovar el inventario de su negocio, con ello sus clientes están satisfechos y ha tenido los ingresos necesarios para subsistir con su familia y cubrir gastos médicos.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar prendas de vestir, bisutería y accesorios para el cabello, le permitirá tener un negocio competitivo y podrá generar ingresos para cancelar la nueva deuda.
texts.en:
Martha used the previous loan to update her business' inventory. With this, her customers are satisfied and she has made the necessary income to survive with her family and cover medical costs.

She is again requesting a loan in order to be able to buy clothing, costume jewelry, and hair accessories. This will allow her to have a competitive business, and she will be able to make income to pay back the new debt.

loans.use: to buy clothing, costume jewelry, and hair accessories, letting her have a competitive business

loans.name: Itab

texts.en: Itab is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She works in the agriculture field and she cooperates with her husband who owns a garage in order to fulfill their family's needs. Because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. This is the second time that she has asked for Kiva’s support to pay the school fees. She is very happy because she will be able to register her children with the coming school.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is 30 years old. She lives in a rural village named Parengerpar in Falakata, West Bengal. Bharati lives there with her husband and two sons in a small hut. Her children are students. Bharati is a very active and energetic lady. She had an opportunity in her childhood to study until ninth grade.  

She is a homemaker who is responsible for managing household activities and looking after her children. The main source of income for her family is vegetable cultivation. She grows vegetables, which are widely consumed by the local people. Bharati helps her husband by going to the nearest villages for door-step vending. Presently, the family earnings are barely enough to manage their family expenses and to save for the future also. So for future development, they have decided to diversify their business with cultivation of ribbed gourd on a large scale, which is a profitable crop. 

To help her husband, Bharati has decided to take a loan from Kiva (a field partner of BJS) to purchase necessary farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for ribbed gourd cultivation. 

She hopes this will help her to increase her family income and manage her family better. Bharati hopes to give a better education to her children.  She has a long-cherished desire to purchase more farmland in the future.

She is very much thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm resources for ribbed gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will have a prosperous business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en: Nazma is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nazma expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Shehnaz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
Maria es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de comunicación social.
Ella es inteligente, dulce, cariñosa, sensible, sincera, Inteligente, comprensiva, paciente y buena oyente. Su carrera la desarrolla en una universidad privada situada en la zona Central de la ciudad, lugar que alberga a la mayoría de las oficinas de empresas públicas y privadas, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura variable entre 0-15 grados centígrados durante el día y todo el año.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja como comerciante y tiene 3 hermanas menores que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de comunicación social y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta estudiando los procesos comunicacionales existentes en cada ámbito social, le gusta la composición de la imagen, su carácter es muy sociable, “estudio en la universidad y también trabajo vendiendo ropa de lana...” comenta. La ventaja de sus labores es que no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para el pago de material de estudios, como; libros, cuadernos, fotocopias, y otros. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y trabajar en un canal de televisión, ella desea realizar la compra de material de estudios y materiales de fotografía, para terminar sus estudios con la especialidad en fotografía. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio y trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de estudios y materiales de fotografía, para terminar sus estudios y trabajar en un canal de televisión.
texts.en:
Maria is a 20-year-old woman, who is single and has no children. She is studying social communication.

She is intelligent, sweet, loving, sensitive, sincere, understanding, patient, and a good listener. She is studying at a private university located in the city center, an area that houses the majority of the offices of public and private business. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 0 and 15 degrees Celsius during the day, year-round.

Maria has tan skin, dark eyes, and long black hair styled fashionably. She is of short stature and slender build. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish in daily living and at school.

She shares her life with her mother who works as a saleswoman, and she has 3 younger sisters who go to school. They live in their own house built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and wooden floor. It has potable water, electricity, and sewer services.

She is studying for a social communication degree and is in the 2nd year of 5 years in the program. She enjoys studying the existing communication processes in each social environment, she likes composition of images, and she has a very social character.

"I go to college and I also work selling wool clothing," she says. The plus is that her work doesn't conflict, but the negative is the lack of capital to pay for study materials like books, notebooks, photocopies, etc.

Her dream is to finish school and work at a tv station. She wants to purchase school materials and photography supplies in order to finish her studies with a specialty in photography. This is her 2nd sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that she has been studying and working.

For those reasons, Maria is asking for a loan to purchase school materials and photography supplies in order to finish her studies and work at a tv station.

loans.use: to buy study materials and photography supplies, in order to finish school and work at a tv station

loans.name: Carmen Dolores

texts.es:
Carmen, se encuentra acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos, que son dependientes, su actividad económica es administrar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, la fundo hace 6 años, trabaja de lunes a domingos, con un horario de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en mantenerse trabajando.
Con el objetivo de ofrecer un mejor inventario a sus clientes, está solicitando un crédito para comprar aceite, pan, frijoles, arroz, boquitas, jugos, etc., le será de ayuda para atraer a nuevos clientes y podrá atenderlos mejor, no tiene riesgos debido a  que la mayoría productos son de larga duración.
Su visión es obtener la máxima utilidad del crédito y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Carmen has a partner and is the mother of 2 dependent children. She has a store that she manages that sells basic consumer goods.  She started this business 6 years ago. She works every day, from 6am until 8pm, and up until now she has not had any difficulties in keeping the store running.

Because she wants to have a bigger inventory to offer to her customers, she is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, bread, beans, rice, snacks, juices, etc.  This will help her to attract new customers and serve them better.  This is not a risky investment, as most of these products have a long shelf life.  

Carmen's vision is to obtain the largest possible profits from this loan and to repay the debt.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Candelaria Digna

texts.es:
Candelaria, continua desarrollando las actividades de costura, el crédito anterior le ayudo a surtir de materia prima su negocio, actualmente cuenta con más clientes satisfechos y nuevos ingresos, que son de utilidad para cancelar sus deudas y cubrir necesidades familiares.
Con el propósito de seguir atendiendo de la mejor manera a sus clientes opta por un nuevo crédito, lo utilizara básicamente para comprar botones, hilos, telas, hombreras, broches, etc., así mismo invertirá en repuestos para la máquina de coser, de esta manera seguirá fortaleciendo su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Candelaria continues to develop her sewing activities.  The previous loan helped her to stock her business with raw materials.  Now she has more satisfied customers and new income which are useful to cancel her debts and cover the family necessities.
With the motive of continuing to attend to her customers in the best way, she is opting for a new loan.  She will use it basically to buy buttons, threads, cloth, pads, brooches, etc. as well as to invest in parts for the sewing machine.  In this way, she will continue strengthening her source of income.

loans.use: to buy buttons, threads, cloth, pads, brooches, etc. as well as to invest in parts for the sewing machine.

loans.name: Amazonas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS” iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de trajes, venta de edredones, venta de muebles, venta de verduras, venta de material escolar, venta de mantas, y venta de alfombras.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys  indica que hace doce años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de trajes para damas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como con su hermana hace varios años, con el poco ahorro que tuvo decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "AMAZONAS" will begin its 28th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Collpani.  It is composed of nine members and is directed by governing board of which Gladys is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank engage in are various among which are costume sales, quilt sales, furniture sales, vegetable sales, school supply sales, cloak sales, and carpet sales.
The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises about which Gladys indicates that twelve years ago she joined Pro Mujer coming in at the invitation of her sister who is a customer of the institution.  Nowadays, she has a costume making and sales business for women. She wants it known that she learned this business working with her sister for several years.  With the little savings she had, she decided to start this business.
The loan she will now take out is to augment her capital (buy cloth wholesale) which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and she will then market it in her sales location in the city of El Alto.  This kind of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family economically since she is single and has a son.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale.

loans.name: Shodi

texts.ru: Шоди мужчина в возрасте 52 лет, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Семья у Шоди большая и чтобы обеспечивать ее ему приходится  трудиться каждый день. Так как он проживает в сельской местности его бизнес это скотоводство, которым он занимается с юных лет. Начинал Шоди с трех голов мелкого скота и постепенно он смог увеличить поголовье скота до 15 голов крупного и мелкого скота. Его бизнес единственный стабильный  источник дохода в семье. На данный момент из-за упадка цены он не может себе позволить продать  скот не потеряв часть прибыли. Шоди обратился в Арванд за поддержкой и надеется получить кредит. На полученные деньги Шоди  хочет купить корм для скота и пару голов крупного скота.
texts.en:
Shodi is a 52-year-old man. He is married and has 5 children. Shodi's family is large, and in order to provide for them, he has to work hard every day. Because he lives in a rural area, his business is raising livestock, which he has done since he was young. Shodi began with three goats, and he was able to gradually increase his herd's headcount to 15 large and small livestock. 

Shodi's business is the sole stable source of income for his family. At the moment, because of a decline in prices, he can't sell livestock without losing part of his profits.
